northup_grumman: Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems, Systems Survivability Directorate is seeking an Aeroacoustic Engineer 5 with Aeroacoustic Engineering and Project Management experience to join our small, highly innovative, productive, and recognized team based in Redondo Beach, California. Northrop Grumman Systems Survivability specializes in the research, design, development, and testing of signature reduction technologies for aircraft systems. In particular, Aeroacoustics Engineering focuses on the aural detection of aircraft as it relates to susceptibility to threats and related impact on mission effectiveness. The successful candidate will simultaneously support numerous diverse projects with a well-balanced set of technical and management skills. These include:  * Relevant aircraft acoustics technology development experience, requiring the application of advanced technical principles and concepts, leading to solutions to complex problems which are highly innovative and impactful  * Interpersonal skills such as strong writing and oral communication abilities, project and technical team mentoring and leadership, and thoughtful decision making  * A self-motivated personality driven by a responsibility to the team and the Government customer community, achieving efficient solutions to technical challenges. Creativity, positivity, and determination are necessary attributes for a candidate who will excel within our small team structure.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications  * Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical or Aeronautical/Aerospace Engineering  * 20 or more years of engineering experience in Aeroacoustics/Acoustics including product development, technology innovation, and full scale aircraft acoustics testing experience  * Strong technical background with a breadth of engineering, leadership, management, and problem solving skills  * An understanding of physical acoustics phenomenology including aircraft component noise source generation, propagation, and detection  * Strong writing/oral presentation skills for application to documentation and technical exchange. Preferred Qualifications  * Master of Science degree in Acoustics or Mechanical Engineering / Aeronautics with a focus in acoustics  * Significant experience with Supply Chain and supplier management including technical, cost, and schedule monitoring and reporting  * Experience with multiple programming languages, comprehensive noise prediction models, measurement systems, and data reduction, analysis, and interpretation Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. The selected candidate will be responsible for ensuring information system compliance with government and corporate security policies and procedures. The selected candidate will also ensure information systems meet security requirements as part of the Assessment and Authorization (A&A) Risk Management Framework (RMF) process. Responsibilities include verifying the configuration of information systems, working with auditors and system administrators on current system security requirements, media handling, file transfers, incident reporting, computer and network contaminations, hardware registration and tracking, audit log review and analysis, software research, and conducting briefings. Knowledge of Nessus and other security tools is a plus. Northrop Grumman Corporation Aerospace Systems (NGAS) is seeking a System Survivability Engineer for System Survivability Product Development to be located in Redondo Beach, California. The individual in this role will support a diverse portfolio of internally and externally funded research and technology development activities. As part of that assignment, he/she will work as part of a multidisciplinary team to determine how survivability technologies can best be integrated into air-based systems within the NGAS portfolio. The System Survivability Engineer 3 applies technical expertise, and has knowledge of related disciplines - specifically design, integration, and fabrication of military propulsion systems. Role and Responsibilities  * Utilize 1D, 2D, and 3D computational electromagnetics codes such as method of moments (MoM) and physical optics (PO) to develop to develop technical solutions for supersonic, survivable inlets.  * Apply previous experiences in design, fabrication, indoor and outdoor test, and data post-processing to verify survivability designs for survivable propulsion systems and components.  * Perform his/her tasks, exercising latitude in determining technical objectives and assignments  * Provide guidance and specific instruction to less experienced engineers This person in this position will function as an integrated team member supporting multi-discipline advanced development programs and technology research and development (R&D) focused on upgrading systems capabilities. As well, this position may have project leadership responsibilities and possibly include support of proposal efforts. The following experiences and competencies are valuable for this position:  * Experience proposing and running successful R&D efforts to develop survivable propulsion components and technology, including budget, schedule, tasking, and review of technical products.  * Experience working on conceptual vehicle design teams and basic understanding of supersonic design requirements as they related to inlet systems.  * Experience working with model fabrication teams and test facilities.  * Ability to successfully lead teams and mentor junior engineers.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications  * Bachelors of Science in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) field of study from an accredited university  * Minimum 5 years engineering experience; 3 years of experience with a Masters;* Experience equivalent to leading at least one low observable technology from requirements and design phase through demonstration in a laboratory (TRL 4) or relevant environment (TRL 5)* Prior experience in signature integration, RCS design, analysis, and testing of other components such as edges or airframe technologies  * Active DoD Secret clearance level (required to start) Preferred Qualifications  * Masters' degree in Electrical, Mechanical, or Aerospace Engineering, or Physics (increased preference will be given to candidates with a background in Applied Electro-Physics  * 7 years of experience directly related to low observable technology development  * Experience equivalent to leading at least one low observable technology from requirements and design phase through demonstration in relevant environment (TRL 6).  * Knowledge of survivable propulsion design techniques and material technologies  * Experience with 3D Method of Moments such as SENTRi and 3D physical optics codes such as Xpatch, and in-house codes such as Switch or GEMS  * Ability to use meshing tools such as FMS, CAE, or Cubit  * Experience with 2D Method of Moments and signature rollup techniques  * Experience with RCS data processing tools, such as Knowbell or Pioneer  * Computer-aided drafting (CAD) skills with, such as Catia or NX  * Excellent verbal and written communication skills  * Active Dod Top Secret clearance and previous SAP/SAR program access Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. Northrop Grumman Technology Services is seeking a Network Communications Engineer 2/3 to support its Redondo Beach, CA location. Roles and Responsibilities include:  * Manages and maintains a smooth operation of network environments while working with systems, network, software, and hardware engineers that are remote and on site.  * Plans, evaluates, and coordinates installation and/or reconfiguration of hardware and software elements of data and/or voice communication network.  * Maintains technical expertise in all areas of network and computer hardware and software interconnection and interfacing, such as routers, firewalls, hubs, IDS/IPS, deep packet inspection analysis, application packet analysis, switches, and proxies.  * May propose solutions to management to ensure all communications requirements based on future needs and current usage, configuring such solutions to optimize cost savings.  * Prepares or ensures that appropriate network documentation exists, including operational instructions.  * Provides regular monitoring and network analysis regarding short- and long-range planning for in-house systems.  * May coordinate third-party maintenance for network equipment.  * May design network or portion of network that include selection of hardware and software packages.  * Work is reviewed for soundness of technical judgment, overall adequacy and accuracy.  * Works under general supervision. This requisition may be filled at a higher grade based on qualifications listed below  Qualifications  This requisition may be filled at either a level 2 or a level 3. Basic Qualifications for a level 2 are:  * Bachelor's degree with a minimum of 2 years of related IT professional experience; 0 years with Masters (An additional 4 years of experience can be substituted in lieu of Bachelor's Degree).  * Hands on experience with routers, switches, load-balancers, or firewalls.  * Ability to troubleshoot complex network issues in a logical fashion for root cause analysis.  * Must be able to obtain certifications to meet DoD 8570 requirements.  * Security+ certification required or able to be attained within first 6 months of onboarding.  * Active DoD Secret clearance is required.  * US Citizenship is required in order to obtain and maintain required security clearance. Basic Qualifications for a level 3 are:  * Bachelor's degree with a minimum of 5 years of related IT professional experience; 3 years with Master's Degree (An additional 4 years of experience can be substituted in lieu of Bachelor's Degree).  * Hands on experience with routers, switches, load-balancers, or firewalls.  * Ability to troubleshoot complex network issues in a logical fashion for root cause analysis.  * Must be able to obtain certifications to meet DoD 8570 requirements.  * Security+ certification required or able to be attained within first 6 months of onboarding.  * Active DoD Secret clearance is required.  * US Citizenship is required in order to obtain and maintain required security clearance.  Preferred Qualifications:  Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:  * Experience with installation and managing specialized network management applications (e.g., HP OpenView, CA Spectrum, SolarWinds, Cisco Secure Servers-ACS-SE).  * CCNP or CISSP certified.  * GIAC Certified: GSNA/GCIH/GCIA  * Active DoD Top Secret Clearance is a plus. Avionics and Tactical Networks (ATN) is an operating unit within the Communications business unit of the Airborne C4ISR Systems division of Northrop Grumman Mission Systems. ATN is located in the Rancho Carmel facility in San Diego, California. We deliver complex equipment to enable modern battlefields and support aviation missions. Our focus is on the world of avionics, radio and electronic warfare product applications to enable networked communications. As part of the corporation's business focus area on Communications, we are the "equipment providers." Our team of communication systems experts is developing next-generation ground radios for land forces, and our Electronic Warfare subject matter experts are creating the next generation of Improvised Explosive Device (IED) countermeasures to keep our soldiers safe when in harm's way. Support senior engineers in the mechanical design and packaging of antenna, RF, digital, infrastructure, and test hardware products, including avionics modules, racks, and interface test adapters. The Field Operations Communications Engineer will be part of a team operating a complex tactical communications system providing voice and data services in a sustained operation located overseas and CONUS. The Primary duties are maintenance of the ground and payload portions of a networked communications system, procedure/report development, and preparing a UAV and/or E-11A for flight operations. The candidate will work closely with an Active Duty/Government customer as well as internal Northrop Grumman Integrated Product Teams (IPTs). Extended travel to hazardous overseas duty locations is required. Must be able to travel overseas (up to 75%). Candidate shall have broad experience with the operations, configuration and maintenance of military communications systems and data links, networks and radios to include the PRC-117, PSC-5, ARC-210, SADL and Link 16 MIDS LVT. Candidate must have knowledge of computers, radios, radio transmission fundamentals, RF theory and A/C power distribution systems as well as commercial and military interface and networking standards to include RS-232, RS-422, 1553, TCP/IP and UDP. Candidate must possess strong analytical and troubleshooting skills and the ability to read electrical drawings and schematics. Candidate should also have experience with electrical soldering and mil-standard connectors. Job tasks include performing preflight system tests, as well as preventative and corrective maintenance of all aspects of a radio based communications system. Preferred Qualifications:  A working knowledge of the Simple Key Loader (SKL) and Windows systems administration is a plus. Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. The Resilient Network Solutions (RNS) team is searching for a Network Engineer level 2 or 3 to join our team in San Diego, CA. Realize the rewards of conquering a new challenge in a dynamic and highly-technical working environment. At Northrop Grumman's RNS Operating Unit, our team of communication systems experts is developing next-generation communication systems for our armed forces. RNS is seeking a highly-motivated Network Communications Engineer to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. The selected candidate will join a team responsible for providing communications functions on multiple, simultaneous RF channels to the world's most sophisticated platforms. Network engineers perform end-to-end networking system integration, and operations, in wide-area heterogeneous networks that include multiple levels of classification. At Northrop Grumman we develop cutting-edge technology that preserves freedom and advances human discovery. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We continue to innovate with developments from launching the first commercial flight to space, to discovering the early beginnings of the universe. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history. The Flight Sciences Organization within the Aerospace Systems Engineering and Global Product Development (E&GPD) organization has multiple openings for qualified applicants in the following areas of Loads & Dynamics Engineering: Airframe Loads Engineer The candidate will support the definition, analysis, and application of structural design criteria and resulting airframe loads for various aerospace projects. The candidate will be responsible for flight loads (steady state maneuvers, abrupt maneuvers, gust response, control surface hinge moments, and aero-elastic effects); and miscellaneous loads (canopy, doors, pressurization, engine mount, external store, tie-down, and aerial refueling). Responsibilities will also include generating and documenting structural design criteria and creating design loads. Responsibilities also include collection of the data required to build analysis models, conduct static and dynamic simulations, interpret and report the results. The candidate will conduct flight loads analysis and tests and produce the associated documentation. The candidate will participate in aircraft development program activities and will coordinate with other engineering disciplines for analysis inputs, design implementation details, documentation of results and interfacing with customers. Flutter and Aeroelasticity Engineer The candidate will conduct flutter/aeroelastic analysis and test coordination for various aerospace projects. Responsibilities will include building dynamic models, conducting static and dynamic aeroelastic analyses, including Flutter, Gust and Aeroelastic effectiveness assessments. The candidate will also be responsible for test planning and coordination for wind tunnel Flutter models, and aircraft ground and flight tests. The candidate will participate in aircraft development program activities and will coordinate with other engineering disciplines for analysis inputs and design implementation details, document results and interface with customers. Vibroacoustic engineer The candidate will define and verify dynamic environmental criteria for the aircraft and related equipment. Responsibilities will include the development of acceleration, vibration, shock and acoustic environments for advanced aircraft, specifying test requirements and analyzing measurements from vehicle and component wind tunnel tests, ground tests and flight tests. Responsibilities will also include interfacing with the equipment suppliers, insuring that their equipment is properly qualified. The candidate will participate in aircraft development program activities and will coordinate with other engineering disciplines for analysis inputs, design implementation details, documentation of results and interfacing with customers. Successful candidates will be self-starting engineers able to perform duties without appreciable direction, or only under consulted direction toward long-range goals, capable of mentoring junior engineers, developing estimates & schedules, leading ground based development test efforts, and leading technical teams engaged in above activities. The Flight Sciences Organization within the Aerospace Systems Engineering and Global Product Development (E&GPD) organization has multiple openings for qualified applicants in the following areas of Loads & Dynamics Engineering: Airframe Loads Engineer The candidate will support the definition, analysis, and application of structural design criteria and resulting airframe loads for various aerospace projects. The candidate will be responsible for flight loads (steady state maneuvers, abrupt maneuvers, gust response, control surface hinge moments, and aero-elastic effects); and miscellaneous loads (canopy, doors, pressurization, engine mount, external store, tie-down, and aerial refueling). Responsibilities will also include generating and documenting structural design criteria and creating design loads. Responsibilities also include collection of the data required to build analysis models, conduct static and dynamic simulations, interpret and report the results. The candidate will conduct flight loads analysis and tests and produce the associated documentation. The candidate will participate in aircraft development program activities and will coordinate with other engineering disciplines for analysis inputs, design implementation details, documentation of results and interfacing with customers. Flutter and Aeroelasticity Engineer The candidate will conduct flutter/aeroelastic analysis and test coordination for various aerospace projects. Responsibilities will include building dynamic models, conducting static and dynamic aeroelastic analyses, including Flutter, Gust and Aeroelastic effectiveness assessments. The candidate will also be responsible for test planning and coordination for wind tunnel Flutter models, and aircraft ground and flight tests. The candidate will participate in aircraft development program activities and will coordinate with other engineering disciplines for analysis inputs and design implementation details, document results and interface with customers. Vibroacoustic engineer The candidate will define and verify dynamic environmental criteria for the aircraft and related equipment. Responsibilities will include the development of acceleration, vibration, shock and acoustic environments for advanced aircraft, specifying test requirements and analyzing measurements from vehicle and component wind tunnel tests, ground tests and flight tests. Responsibilities will also include interfacing with the equipment suppliers, insuring that their equipment is properly qualified. The candidate will participate in aircraft development program activities and will coordinate with other engineering disciplines for analysis inputs, design implementation details, documentation of results and interfacing with customers. Successful candidates will be self-starting engineers able to perform duties without appreciable direction, or only under consulted direction toward long-range goals, capable of mentoring junior engineers, developing estimates & schedules, leading ground based development test efforts, and leading technical teams engaged in above activities. Preferred Qualifications:  * A current in scope DoD Secret, Top Secret or SSBI/SCI clearance  * Experience in the use of industry standard loads and dynamics analysis software (NASTRAN, FEMAP, PATRAN, MATLAB, and ZONAIR).  * Working experience with aircraft loads requirements (JSSG-2006, FAR Part 23 and 25)* Work experience in the area of aircraft dynamics loads, vibroacoustic, response analysis, and dynamic environment prediction.  * Work experience in the area of aircraft dynamics loads, flutter, aeroelasticity, model correlation, and PSD Gust.  * Experience on aircraft development programs performing response analysis and dynamic environment prediction.  * Knowledge of Multi-Disciplinary Optimization tools and techniques is desired.  * Siemens NX knowledge is desirable  * Current Top Secret and SAP/SAR clearances are preferred. The Flight Sciences Organization within the Aerospace Systems Engineering and Global Product Development (E&GPD) organization has multiple openings for qualified applicants in the area of Mass Properties. Resilient Network Solutions (RNS) develops, fields and sustains systems and infrastructures to connect disparate systems and enable network-centric operations. Major programs include Battlefield Airborne Communications Node (BACN), and Roll-On Beyond Line-of-Sight Enhancement (ROBE). Communications background; The candidate must possess 0-6 years specific experience or similar experience in related field and military technical equivalent. The Payload Field Engineer will be part of a team operating a complex tactical system, providing voice and data services in a sustained operational location overseas and CONUS. Duties include operating and maintaining the ground node portions of a network communications system, develop operational procedures and reports, and preparing a airborne mission system payloads for flight. Candidate shall have broad experience with the operations, configuration and maintenance of military communications systems and data links, networks and radios to include the PRC-117, PSC-5, ARC-210, SADL and Link 16 MIDS LVT. Candidate should have knowledge of computers, radios, radio transmission fundamentals, RF theory and A/C power distribution systems as well as commercial and military interface and networking standards to include RS-232, RS-422, 1553, TCP/IP and UDP. Candidate should possess strong analytical and troubleshooting skills and the ability to read electrical drawings and schematics. Candidate should also have experience with electrical soldering and mil-standard connectors. Job tasks include performing preflight system tests, as well as preventative and corrective maintenance of all aspects of a radio based communications system. The candidate will work closely with the Active Duty/Government customer as well as internal; NG Contingency & Deployment (CDO) and System Engineering Teams. Extended travel to hazardous overseas duty locations required. Position is within the Engineering Flight Release Center coordinating Chief Engineer and Responsible Engineer approvals for Ground and Flight Test as well as the analysis and disposition of anomalies occurring during Ground and Flight Test. Northrop Grumman is a leading global security company providing innovative systems, products, and solutions in unmanned systems, logistics and modernization, cyber security, and C4ISR to government and commercial customers. We operate in all 50 states and 25 countries with 65,000 employees who are committed to innovation, development, and discovery. Here at Northrop Grumman, we seek to deliver the value of performance by bringing the next generation of technology to life. Our professionals live and breathe different perspectives here; we are curious about the world, accepting of each other, and well aware that the more ideas, backgrounds, opinions, and experiences we bring to our work, the stronger that work will be. Just as you would invest your time and hard work into our company, we focus on investing back into you through enriching professional experiences and high-quality learning and development opportunities. We want you to bring your whole self to work and for you to have meaningful connections with your coworkers, customers, and communities, while providing the best products, systems, and technologies to protect our world. We are seeking an innovative, hands-on, and team-oriented Java Developer with strong leadership characteristics to join our Special Programs team. The Java Developer IV designs, develops, documents, tests and debugs applications software and systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions. Conducts multidisciplinary research and collaborates with equipment designers and/or hardware engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software. Determines computer user needs; analyzes system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls; prepares operating instructions; designs and develops compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems. Ensures software standards are met.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or STEM degree, plus a minimum of 9 years experience, to include developing enterprise solutions for Java 2 Platform Enterprise Edition (J2EE) in a SOA environment. Experience required in object oriented programming, design patterns, middleware technologies (e.g., DDS, ActiveMQ), application servers (e.g., GlassFish, WebLogic, JBoss, etc), data grid technologies. Experience required with integrating software from third party sources. Applicant must be familiar with Agile software development practices. Top Secret clearance is required to start. Ability to obtain special program access.  Preferred Qualifications:  Master's degree in Computer Science; Experience with NASA World Wind, JavaFX, JMS and SOAP. Experience with sensor/payload Command and Control (C2), or experience with Open Mission Systems (OMS) or the UAS C2 Initiative (UCI). Experience with UI development using HTML, Spring Web Flow, JSF, and RichFaces; and/or experience desired in, Hibernate, Spring, continuous integration, EJBs, or JAXB, and/or data transfer technologies (e.g., UDT, FFT, etc). Top Secret with Special Program Access. Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. Join us on the edge... The Cutting Edge! Northrop Grumman Mission Systems sector is seeking Cybersecurity Engineers (formally Information Assurance) to join our team of highly qualified individuals. This is a pipeline staffing requisition to source qualified talent for current, on-going, and future talent needs in this area of expertise. This position will be located in Boulder, Colorado. Cybersecurity Engineer applies system security engineering principles to provide realistic solutions designed to enhance the security posture. Identify threats and develop appropriate protection measures, review system changes for security implications and recommend improvements, research and draft Cybersecurity white papers, and provide top tier support to the Cybersecurity operations staff for resolving complex Cybersecurity issues. Develop and maintain a system-level Plan of Actions and Milestones (POA&M). Successful candidate will be able to evaluate different network and enclave configurations with respect to the D0DI 8510.01 and NIST 800-53 Security Controls and formulate effective Risk Management Framework (RMF) processes & accreditation packages. Write RMF-based policies and procedures, and develop sound Cybersecurity processes to include implementation. Successful candidate will be accountable for quality work products. Must be able to prioritize and execute tasks and enjoy working in a collaborative team environment, prepare coherent and concise documentation required for certification evaluation. Job responsibilities may include the following:  * Develop sound Cybersecurity processes to include implementation of RMF-based policies and procedures.  * Conduct assessments of systems and networks within the networking environment or enclave and identify where those systems and networks deviate from acceptable configurations, enclave policy, or local policy.  * Execute vulnerability assessments; ensure mitigation of risks and support obtaining certification and accreditation of systems.  * Support the formal Security Test and Evaluation (ST&E) required by each government accrediting authority through pre-test preparations, participation in the tests, analysis of the results and preparation of required reports.  * Document the results of Certification and Accreditation activities and technical or coordination activity and prepare the system Security Plans and update the Plan of Actions and Milestones POA&M.  * Conduct technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems.  * Perform analyses at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal.  * Ensure the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints. Perform functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications. This requisition may be filled at a higher grade based on the qualifications listed below.  Qualifications  This requisition may be filled at either a level 3 or a level 4. Basic Qualifications for a Band 3:  * Bachelor of Science degree in engineering or related field and 5+ years of experience  * US citizenship required  * Active TS with the ability to gain an SCI clearance required.  * Candidate must hold an active DoD 8570 IA Workforce Improvement Program IAT Level II Technical Level Certification/s (Security+). Preferred Qualifications for a Band 3:  * Active Top Secret /SCI security clearance  * Candidate must hold an active DoD 8570 IA Workforce Improvement Program IAT Level III Technical Level Certification/s (CISSP).  * Working knowledge of Linux Red Hat and Microsoft operating systems.  * Working knowledge and understanding of boundary protection devices, including firewalls and IPS devices.  * Understanding of project schedule & planning basics. Basic Qualifications for a Band 4:  * Bachelor of Science Degree, 9+ yrs. of engineering work experience in Cybersecurity Engineering  * US citizenship required  * Active TS with the ability to gain an SCI clearance required.  * Candidate must hold an active DoD 8570 IA Workforce Improvement Program IAT Level II Technical Level Certification/s (Security+).  * Candidates must possess strong interpersonal, organizational, and team skills with demonstrated skills in successfully leading teams.  * Ability to support up to 25% travel within the United States to customer or other NGC facilities. Preferred Qualifications for a Band 4:  * Bachelor of Science Degree, 9+ yrs. of engineering work experience in Cybersecurity Engineering, plus minimum 3 yrs. in development and/or sustainment for OPIR Ground Systems/Programs or relevant technical leadership experience.  * Active Top Secret /SCI security clearance  * Experience in Risk Management Framework (RMF); proposal development to include Basis Of Estimate (BOE) creation.  * Cost Account Management (CAM) experience in support of Earned Value Management Systems (EVMS) on Programs.  * Candidate must hold an active DoD 8570 IA Workforce Improvement Program IAT Level III Technical Level Certification/s (CISSP).  * Previous or current System Administration (SA) or test experience with UNIX, AIX, Linux and or Windows systems is highly desired. Northrop Grumman is seeking candidates for the position of Engineer Communications Systems /Systems Administrator 3/4. Primary responsibility is to support the hardware design, development, and integration of ground processing stations of satellite data. These systems have a mix of Operating Systems (LINUX, IRIX, Windows) in both development lab environments and deployed operational environments. Engineer Communications Systems/Systems Administrators are responsible for installing, configuring, and maintaining network infrastructure to include routers, switches, firewalls and the connections to servers and workstations. Assist end users with account maintenance, system configuration, setup, and requested baseline configuration changes. Duties may include scripting for optimizing IT environment and network installations, project management for defining and implementing upgrades to the IT environment, and serving as consultant for computer problems beyond the knowledge of engineering staff. Engineer Communications Systems/Systems Administrators must demonstrate a blend of engineering, advanced technical skills and excellent communication abilities. Experience with Linux and Windows server OS, network attached Storage and LUNS, standalone and blade server platforms, NIDS appliances and management, along with virtual machine and hypervisor implementations Understanding of standard DOD security practices such as, STIG compliance and system accreditation implementation efforts. Seeking a hardware engineer to work a small team of engineers responsible for the design and production of Ground Control Stations for Autonomous Aircraft. The engineering team is made up of mechanical, electrical, computer, and hardware engineers and they are subdivided into 3 teams: drawings, hardware design, and production. These individuals and teams work together and get exposure to different fields. Already having experience in multiple engineering disciplines. The drawing team creates, revises, and releases 2D CAD drawings that are made with CATIA. They must work closely with other teams to capture the changes that come as a result of new designs, obsolescence, and correction of deficiencies. The design team does hardware design as a result of changing requirements or obsolescence. Most of the hardware used is commercial computing and networking hardware. They conduct trade studies, perform thermal analysis, perform power analysis, and write procedures on equipment checkout. The production team overseas the assembly of the designed ground station. They work closely with manufacturing and quality to ensure everything is built to specs. They must track hardware components as they are delivered and perform a final system sell off to the government customer.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor's Degree in Engineering. 5 years engineering experience with Bachelor's Degree. 3 years engineering experience with Master's Degree. Must be able to obtain Secret Security Clearance if hired. Strong verbal and written communication skills.  Preferred Qualifications:  Ground Systems Experience Experience in a production or manufacturing environment Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. How do cyber terrorists get past the industry's best? They don't. There are too many of us fighting virtual threats, protecting enterprises and entire countries from large-scale attacks. From creating a citywide wireless network for our first responders, to protecting our nation from cyber threats, to building software-defined radios that change how our military communicates, our Cyber and Intelligence Mission Solutions Division helps life run smoothly and safely. If you are the sort of person who loves a challenge and likes to be involved in serious organizational and software change  -- Then what is happening in the Cyber and Intelligence Mission Solutions Division is the place for you. This is without a doubt one of the most interesting and exciting times to join an organization like ours. The culture is one of excellence; team work, learning, delivered value and people. We are looking for people who love to learn and take initiative to really make this happen. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems is seeking a Senior Cyber Software Engineer 6 to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals located at Annapolis Junction, MD.  Roles and Responsibilities:  The candidate will design, develop, document, test and maintain applications software and systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions. Conduct multidisciplinary research and collaborate with equipment designers and/or hardware engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software. Determine computer user needs; analyze system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls; prepares operating instructions; designs and develops compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems. Ensures software standards are met. As one of the most senior technical experts on the team, you will, interface directly with users and customers providing foresight and technical guidance aimed at satisfying mission needs. As a key contributor to the success of the program, you will collaborate with software and systems engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of complex software systems. You will provide technical leadership to the software development team and work complex technical tasks under general guidance from the team lead. As a Principal Engineer on this program, you will be asked to mentor and facilitate the development of junior engineers who join. Additionally, you will interact with senior company management and customers, responsible for generating white papers and innovative solutions for program growth and will be responsible to convey new techniques and technologies to the analytic workforce. Our professionals live and breathe different perspectives here; we are curious about the world, accepting of each other, and well aware that the more ideas, backgrounds, opinions, and experiences we bring to our work, the stronger that work will be. Just as you would invest your time and hard work into our company, we focus on investing back into you through enriching professional experiences and high-quality learning and development opportunities. We want you to bring your whole self to work and for you to have meaningful connections with your coworkers, customers, and communities, while providing the best products, systems, and technologies to protect our world. The Electro-Mechanical Design Checker performs various tasks in checking designs for Engineering at Northrop Grumman, including: examining production engineering drawings and ECNs related documents for soundness, efficiency, and simplicity in design; completeness, clarity, and dimensional accuracy; correctness of materials and processes; conformity to design/drafting standards, design specifications, and practicability; and economy of fabrication, assembly, and installation data which make up the Technical Data Packages in accordance with military and contractual specifications and Northrop Grumman policies. Identifies design errors, omissions, and other deficiencies, and recommends revisions and/or improvements in design layout to responsible engineers or designers. Types of hardware include Space Payload, Mechanical Ground Support Equipment (MGSE) and System Test Equipment (STE) systems. Manager for a diverse organization of approximately 53 inspectors, engineers, managers, and support staff encompassing five departments: Supplier Mission Assurance (including Metrology), Quality Systems & Process Management, Infrastructure Engineering Mission Assurance (Inspection, QA Engineering, Software Quality), EH&S, and Mission Success. Supplier Mission Assurance responsibilities includes the supplier management and product integrity of incoming commodities evaluation, monitoring, and management, Source Inspection, Receiving Inspection and planning, metrology, and Receiving Inspection (RI) related processes and metrics [F2 QNs, Supplier Discrepancy Action Requests (SDARs), Risk Release, and Supplier Corrective Action Requests (SCARs)]. Metrology is the primary calibration service provider for test equipment within the site, with the responsibility for developing and maintaining calibration processes in accordance with industry standards. Quality Systems and Process Management responsibilities includes maintaining the AS9100 site registrar certification, internal auditing and compliance, continuous improvement, process support, documentation storage and offload. It also includes in house Process Management support and leading/working sector and corporate initiatives related to improvement initiatives and synergy commonality across the sector/corporation. This includes Command Media transition, Leadership Media management, and CMMI compliance/certification readiness. Infrastructure Engineering and Inspection responsibilities includes programs product integrity support, proposal/C510 support, subcontractors, hardware, software, integration and test, and factory production F3 Quality Notification (QN) metrics. Directly responsible for leading the following: Executive CAB/PCCB, campus ESD/FOD Steering committee, GIDEPs/Alerts, CMMI compliance, and executive level FRACAS. Oversees Environmental Health and Safety Program within the NGES Azusa Campus, in accordance with NGES's Environmental, Health, Safety and Fire Protection Policy, and compliant with Regulatory Agency requirements. In addition the Azusa site MA manager is responsible for Mission Success. The Mission Success organization provides visibility of the program's products and processes that is independent of the performing organizations to the Mission Assurance site organization and to the SBIRS Program Manager to ensure that the delivered products have been developed, manufactured, and tested in compliance with company and contractual processes and will fulfill their intended functions once deployed. The MA Manager Establishes quality management systems in compliance with this policy and customer requirements as well as being the Quality System Management Representative (QSMR) for the Azusa campus. Establishes and communicates objectives for quality performance at all levels. Strives to understand MA best practices utilized within NG Corporate, NGAS sector, and at the other NG sister sectors as well as the industry. Adopts MA best practices in Azusa as warranted. He/She is accountable for providing the people, processes, and tools necessary to meet program requirements, and for ensuring that overall budgets, schedules and performance standards are met. He/she determines and establishes organizational structures and supervisory relationships and ensures that programs are appropriately staffed. The MA Manager ensures that they recruit and retain the talent required to address existing and new business opportunities. He/she is the primary point of contact between the Azusa site VP and the Global Mission Excellence organization based at Space Park. He/she implements strategic initiatives in line with MCS (Military Civil Space) and GME (Global Mission Excellence) requirements and focus areas.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math)* Must have a minimum 10 years of experience of both functional and/or project management of quality/technical/engineering teams, management level direct reports, and within a DoD contractor environment  * Experience must also have included resource planning (people, processes, tools)* Active Secret security clearance  Preferred Qualifications:  * Advanced degree (Masters' degree or PhD) in Engineering, and/or an MBA  * Management of staff and operations in geographically dispersed locations  * Active SCI security clearance Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. The EMI/EMC Electrical Engineer 4 responsibilities include leading and overseeing EMI processes and operations, as well as electrical/RF test and analysis of systems, subsystems, and components. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: EMI/EMC: - Define and implement EMI/EMC requirements to meet specified product performance for all aspects of Electromagnetic Environmental Effects (E3) compliance, including EMI/EMC/EME/ESD/EMP and lightning. - System level EMC design (system level grounding/isolation design, generate electrical bonding specifications, filtering designs and shielding designs). - RF radiation hazard analysis to personnel and ordnance. - Develop models for interference coupling mechanisms, shielding integrity, and circuit/cable interface isolation to mitigate and control conducted/radiated emissions and susceptibility stimuli. - Conduct component and system EMI RE and RS tests. - Generate EMI control plans, and test guidelines, procedures, reports and waivers. Electrical/RF: - Familiar with electrical and RF test equipment - Experience with electrical and RF test or troubleshooting techniques - Demonstrate the ability to lead, coordinate, solve problems, and work well in a team environment. Northrop Grumman Military/Civil Space Mission Operations specializes in support for on-orbit operational sensor payloads, including monitoring, trending, and analysis of state of health and mission performance and mission capabilities, including data analysis and end-to-end system interface testing. The team is seeking an innovative and motivated individual to lead the Mission Operations Flight Test & Evaluation section, primarily located in the Azusa, CA facility. This position is ~20% functional organizational management of 12-15 engineering staff with a wide range of experience and skills. The selected candidate must be able to develop 80% direct contract work coverage. Previous experience with satellite or ground systems operations is strongly preferred. This position requires a solid understanding of engineering test disciplines in a space systems context in order to help establish, evaluate performance, and train effective work processes and procedures. The manager may be called upon to support sensor, payload, ground, or system testing including launch readiness activities, on-orbit qualification testing, payload command product validation, anomaly investigation, and mission data analysis. The functional organization primarily supports the Space-Based Infrared Systems (SBIRS) and Missile Defense System Exerciser (MDSE) programs. SBIRS is an Overhead Persistent Infrared (OPIR) space surveillance system with several payloads on orbit and additional assets scheduled to launch over the next few years. MDSE supports the operational development and testing of both strategic and tactical missile defense systems for the Missile Defense Agency (MDA). Strong people leadership skills are required, including the ability to identify and develop staff capabilities, support career development, evaluate and manage staff performance, identify and recognize achievement, and plan staffing support for programs. The manager would also be responsible for ensuring process compliance and supporting department initiatives. Additional responsibilities may be assigned commensurate with performance or due to business needs.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math)* 10 years of experience in satellite operations or test and ground system operations  * Experience leading a team of at least 3-5 team members  * Active DoD Secret clearance with ability to obtain and maintain TS/SSBI  * U.S. Citizenship  Preferred Qualifications:  * Master's degree  * Active TS/SSBI clearance  * Recent CAM/EV experience Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are looking for a Software Configuration Analyst to join Northrop Grumman's Defense Travel System (DTS) 24x7 operational support, creating maintaining and executing scripts and processes used to facilitate service delivery, maintain system configuration, and reporting processes for the DTS application. The Defense Travel System (DTS) is a fully integrated, automated, end-to-end travel management system that enables DoD travelers to create authorizations (TDY travel orders), prepare reservations, receive approvals, generate travel vouchers, and receive a split reimbursement between their bank accounts and the Government Travel Charge Card (GTCC) vendor. DTS operates at over 9,500 total sites worldwide. Qualified applicants will:  * Develop and maintain software configuration management tools to support configuration identification, control, reporting, and delivery of both internally developed and externally purchased commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) software products  * Perform configuration management and release engineering tasks to ensure new software product operating parameters are documented, comply with standard hardware configurations, and are logistically sustainable.  * Design, develop, automate, and maintain productivity tools using programming, database or scripting languages to improve software modeling and development.  * Design and implement build procedures that are used to support software product development and use. May develop software configuration standards for company-wide use. May train software developers in the use of configuration management tools and the implementation of software quality standards.  .  Roles and Responsibilities:  * Planning and coordinating activities related to CM  * Tracking and analyzing configuration item data, to include hardware, defect, and change data, as well as other CM related metrics  * Maintaining the project configuration management library  * Create, review and edit program documentation to include standard operating procedures  * Developing, monitoring and coordinating the program configuration control process, moderating or chairing CM meetings  * Establishing and maintaining procedures for managing configuration baselines Administering the CM suite of tools  * Working with a team of engineers to support baseline changes from development through production  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * Bachelor's of Science degree and 1 year of professional work experience, preferably in an Information Technology environment  * Experience with Configuration Management Tools such as JIRA, Confluence, and SharePoint  * US citizenship and the ability to obtain a clearance.  Preferred Qualifications:  Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:  * Experience in devising and implementing strategies for managing and maintaining hardware configuration items through the systems lifecycle  * Ability to develop alternate approaches for solving problems, and possess solid interpersonal and communication skills.  * Experience with JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint, and other configuration management tools a plus. The candidates must understand how their tasks fit within the overall program objectives and perform their work accordingly. The junior/ mid-level engineers will have the opportunity to engagement with NGC leadership, external business partners and customers, as required to provide technical information regarding the program. The candidate will support an off-site System and Operation & Maintenance program located in various geographic locations to perform in a team of cross-discipline specialty engineers, and be responsible for (but not limited to) the following tasks:  * Perform technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, risk and opportunity assessments, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems.  * Perform functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, system data trending & performance analysis, requirements allocation and interface definition studies.  * Devise modeling and measuring techniques; utilize mathematics, statistical methods, engineering methods, operational mathematics techniques (linear programming, game theory, probability theory, symbolic language, etc.), and other principles and laws of scientific disciplines.  * Support the identification, development and improvement of system operation and maintenance processes/products  * Supporting system problem/anomaly resolution; investigate and diagnose unexpected system signatures  * Identify and implement new or improved tools and processes to increase team efficiency The positions are for various shifts, in support of 24/7 operations. Initial work will begin during 'normal day shift hours,' but will transition to shift work. Shift work will be required during training and testing activities, as well as operations. The candidate should be prepared to work different shifts when required.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * Basic qualifications for a Level 2 are a Bachelor's Degree in Systems Engineering or related STEM discipline with 2 years of experience or Master's Degree in Systems Engineering with 0 years of experience. Basic qualifications for a Level 3 are a Bachelor's Degree in Systems Engineering or related STEM discipline with 5 years of experience, Master's Degree in Systems Engineering with 3 years of experience, or 0 years of experience with a PhD.  * Knowledge of system life cycle and system engineering best practices; and applying engineering disciplines to real world activities/systems.  * Experience in complex system assessment/analysis; with exceptional attention to detail.  * Familiarity with distributed computing systems and/or real-time computing/messaging systems  * Experience with defining and/or developing data reduction and analysis tools to process large amounts of data.  * Experience with MATLAB or other analysis and trending tools.  * Familiarity with Windows, UNIX, and/or Linux operating systems.  * Ability to work at a government facility within a multi-contractor (badgeless) team environment.  * U.S. Citizenship required. A current/active TS/SCI clearance is required.  Preferred Qualifications:  * Familiarity with software development environments  * Experience with high-level coding languages and scripting/interpreted languages, such as C/C++, Visual Basic, Java, JavaScript, Python, Perl, Shell Script, bash, and awk.  * Proficiency with MS Office applications (e.g., Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Access, Visio).  * Familiarity with Nagios, ClearQuest, Oracle, MySQL, and SharePoint, or related applications.  * Experience determining whether or not the system performance meets mission requirements.  * Strong interpersonal skills; a positive, helpful, and professional demeanor.  * Strong verbal/written communication skills, along with the ability to work well within a team environment. Northrop Grumman Information Systems is currently in need of an Engineer Systems 2 for the Northrop Grumman Enhanced C2BMC (EC2BMC) SCOUT activities in support of the Missile Defense Agency. The objectives of the EC2BMC follow-on effort includes defining the system concepts, with emphasis on developing prototype software capabilities, supporting MDA experiments for advanced discrimination algorithms, and supporting MDA in integrating and demonstration of advanced discrimination algorithms into the Ballistic Missile Defense System (BMDS). Northrop Grumman Information Systems sector is seeking a Help Desk Specialist to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in McLean, VA. The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Postal Solutions Virtual Development Center, supporting the United States Postal Service on CODES. The Computerized On-Site Data Entry System (CODES) applications are custom applications developed and modified over the years to provide data collection for Statistical Programs. This position will be under general supervision, responsible for receiving all user comments, questions, and complaints about software and systems utilized by the client. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems is seeking a candidate with a Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related engineering discipline and an in-depth knowledge of Systems Architecture and Integration. We are located in Orlando, Florida's Research Park which has become the World's epicenter of simulation technologies. At our location, we provide dynamic, cost effective distributed training solutions to our nation's finest combat aviators. We furnish the high-speed secure systems and networks that allow geographically disparate combat units to train together in a virtual battle space. We also develop the standards which allow interoperability between multiple different military flight simulation systems. We are truly at the cutting edge of simulation technology. We want you to come and join our dynamic, energetic team of professionals. This Engineer Systems position will develop computer systems using off-the-shelf products including servers, networking gear, and custom software packages by following defined processes. Scholastic and hands on experience in building computers and networks is required. Work is often performed in a team-environment which requires strong written and oral communications skills. A proven history of personal commitment and initiative, as well as the ability to set and achieve significant goals as an individual contributor and in a team is required. This Engineer must be a proven team player with good interpersonal skills who is highly adaptable and has proven successful in diverse technical areas, both scholastically and inside the workplace. After gaining experience working with the Orlando, providing technical insight, along with occasional task leadership will be required. Other responsibilities will include operation and troubleshooting of developed systems, documentation of new and existing processes, and the installation and testing of systems in the field. A mentality of continuous process and system improvement is a critical component to this Engineer's success. Attention to detail is critical for properly supporting this role, as is following through until successful task completion is reached. Provides responsive, quality customer service and support at all times for internal Northrop Grumman and external Air Force stakeholders. Performs immediate analysis of customer problems and directs the implementation of corrective action to restore function and avoid recurrence. Candidate will be required to work on small to medium size, collaborative teams with government, military, industry partners, and other Northrop Grumman employees. Air travel will be required. Join the men and women of Northrop Grumman Mission Systems in meeting the largest, most complex systems challenges imaginable for government, military and business. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) seeks to fill the Cyber Logistics Services Manager Level 2 in the Engineering, Manufacturing, & Logistics (EM&L) function. This is a dual role encompassing both people leadership and technical performance. The Manager of Cyber Logistics Services is responsible for the planning, staffing, directing, and managing the cost, schedule and performance of assigned programs and personnel within parameters for function. Responsibilities require the close coordination and integration of team activities across multiple product lines and with other functional departments and Integrated Product Teams as required in support of program objectives. The manager position also coordinates the preparation of all proposals, proposal work statements and specifications, scope of work for production, operating budgets for all assigned personnel, and workload planning and forecasting. Excellent communication/presentation skills and an in-depth knowledge of ILS management, sustainment and production program execution, Earned Value Management, and Risk Management systems are required. Emphasis in this position is placed on leadership with focus on strategic vision and growth of the organization to meet both current and future mission needs. The candidate must be able to establish and maintain effective program oversight, functional management, and customer communication on multiple programs with multiple customers. The successful candidate must be able to take top level system requirements documents and define and organize the detailed tasks/schedule/skills required to meet the requirements within cost and schedule constraints. This includes management of tools development. Additional duties include personnel performance evaluation, merit planning, employee development, recruiting, workload planning and forecasting, and time approval. This position is also responsible for staffing and workload forecast; employee inclusion, engagement, mentoring and career development; employee training and identification and training of skills required to execute on programs. The responsibilities include the recruiting, sourcing, onboarding, performance management and contract maintenance for the contractors working in the business area. The successful candidate will clearly demonstrate strong leadership skills to achieve sustainable top performance. He/she will have a track record as an effective communicator and problem solver who is able to develop and maintain good working relationships with internal and external stakeholders. This candidate will demonstrate a commitment to ethics and integrity, and the capability to innovate while challenging traditional ways of doing business. Demonstrated abilities to build diverse and inclusive teams with high levels of engagement, including mentoring and coaching, are a must. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required and the ideal candidate will have demonstrated success collaborating and leading virtually as a part of a geographically dispersed team. This candidate will demonstrate a broad skill set that is balanced between interpersonal, business, and technical capabilities. He / she will have an ability to operate in a team environment and collaborate across the sector business areas as required to accomplish the team goals. The candidate will work closely with the directors and managers of other engineering disciplines, program directors and program managers. The ideal candidate will also be able to champion change within the organization, to achieve competitive advantage for the business. Travel up to 25% of is anticipated. Experience leading high performance teams and managing multiple priorities with cost and schedule responsibilities. U.S. Citizen with current Security Clearance- Secret Requires excellent communication and organizational capabilities. Must be able to establish and maintain effective customer communication. Northrop Grumman is seeking a Helpdesk/Data Center Technician to join our Enterprise Shared Services Support team in Melbourne ,FL. The position provides day-to-day helpdesk and operational support for a new Strategic Systems program Data Center. A successful candidate will have technical skills that demonstrate a strong understanding of Helpdesk operations, the ability to effectively communicate with interpersonal skills, resolves technical problems and answers queries by telephone in support of internal customer computer hardware, software, network, and telecommunications systems, excellent problem solving skills, and will contribute to deliverables and performance metrics where applicable. This position will also play a significant local support presence in tasks workflow and implementation, coordination of both Prod/Dev support, and act as a local technical point of contact for Data Center infrastructure related requests and issues. Function as a 2nd shift member of the team responsible for 24x7x365 helpdesk operations and Data Center monitoring in a mission critical enterprise environment. Serve as a Data Center point of contact facilitating Incident Management process. Provide technical support for the Physical/Virtual server infrastructure, incident, change and problem management ticketing systems, including operating system security & patch management. Responsible for equipment life cycle management, including the installation (racking,cabling,labeling), configuration, and upgrade of equipment in a multi-platform environment consisting of Microsoft Windows, and Linux. Analyze and document the status of operation equipment in data center equipment to include servers, routers, and switches. Provide escort to un-cleared personnel or vendors in order to remediate outages, equipment failures or contracted installations. Perform daily system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems and key processes. Maintain, update, and disseminate Standard Operating Procedures. Develop and document technical processes and procedures as needed. Have strong written and verbal communication skills to communicate clearly and comprehensively to senior leadership and technical experts. Have strong organization and time-management skills, a "can-do" attitude, and the ability to multi-task; comfortable with changing priorities. Have outstanding customer service experience working to meet SLAs in an ITIL environment. Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems Sector is offering a challenging and rewarding career as a Hypersonic Thermal/Structural Engineer in Melbourne, FL. This position will support hypersonic vehicle design and high temperature testing in a multi-disciplinary team environment. The selected candidate will work within the NG NEXT organization. The candidate should have a fundamental working knowledge of hypersonic vehicle systems and be able to support design, development, and production. This position will be focused on material and structural analysis related to hypersonic flight including: high-temperature metals, composites, joints and gaps and ablative thermal protection systems. The right individual shall be able to model hot structures, charring, fatigue limits, finite elements, loading, surface chemical reactions, pyrolysis, and TPS sizing. The candidate shall be able to work as a team member and independently as a subject matter expert and advisor to management. Candidates are expected to be able to lay out testing plans to validate analysis models and to lead a team of individuals working in a structural/thermal subject area. The resulting analysis will need to be effectively communicated and presented to program management and a multi-disciplinary team. The individual may need to interface with customers, subcontractors, and suppliers. Data from tests will need to be distilled down into pertinent points and used to update design models. Experience with ground testing such as arc jet, shock tube, hypersonic wind tunnel, or other related structure/thermal testing is a plus. Experience with carbon/carbon, metal matrix composites, and ceramic matrix composites is a plus. Modeling or hands on experience with fuel system thermal management is a plus. The candidate shall have experience with one or more of the following codes:  * Thermal Desktop  * Charring Material Ablation  * CARE  * ABAQUS  * ANSYS  * Matlab  * Model Center  * PATRAN  * NASTRAN  * Aerotherm CMA  * SINDA  * Other equivalent software  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience 7 years of direct experience with all aspects of mechanical engineering 2 years of direct experience with hypersonic structure/thermal analysis Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple projects developed and deployed simultaneously Ability to work in a team-oriented environment  Preferred Qualifications:  MS or PhD in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering or related field 5 years of direct experience with hypersonic structure/thermal analysis Knowledge Knowledge of Northrop Grumman processes Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. This position is for experienced Loads and Dynamics engineer to support aircraft applications. The candidate will join the Loads and Dynamics department in Southern California (El Segundo). As a Loads and Dynamics engineer he/she will support Aircraft programs, and Advanced Technologies. As a subject matter experts (SME), the candidate will lead the development of design loads criteria and governing documents; flight loads (steady state maneuvers, abrupt maneuvers, gust response, control surface hinge moments, and all including aero-elastic effects); ground loads (ground handling, landing loads, taxi and take-off loads, and drop test loads); miscellaneous loads (canopy, doors, pressurization, engine mount, external store, tie-down/mooring, and aerial refueling); dynamics loads ( gust response, buffet analysis, store ejection, impact, and vibro-acoustics), fatigue spectra (master event spectrum, event sequencing, and loads spectra); flight and ground testing (loads instrumentation and calibration, structural static/proof, flight ground vibration test planning); flutter analysis, and aeroelasticity analysis. The candidate will be involved in catapult loads, arresting loads, shipboard deck handling loads and crash loads. He/she will help execute dynamics testing including pre-test analysis, data reduction and model correlation. The candidate will be responsible for performing analyses using commercial and in-house codes and providing solutions to a variety of loads and dynamics related technical problems of moderate scope and complexity. He/she will lead internal research activities and will be expected to set technical directions for the department. The candidate will coordinate with other engineering disciplines for analysis inputs and design implementation details, document results and interface with external customers. He/she will review other people's work for soundness of technical judgment and overall quality.  Qualifications Basic Qualifications: * Bachelor of Science degree in Aerospace Engineering, from an accredited university, with an emphasis in aircraft loads and structural dynamics. * 18+ years of aircraft loads and structural dynamics engineering experience. * Work experience that includes flight loads, ground loads, miscellaneous loads, dynamics loads ( gust response, buffet analysis, store ejection, impact, and vibro-acoustics), fatigue spectra (master event spectrum, event sequencing, and loads spectra), flight and ground testing (loads instrumentation and calibration, structural static/proof, flight ground vibration test planning); flutter analysis, and aeroelasticity analysis. * Experience in the use of industry standard loads and dynamics analysis software (NASTRAN, PATRAN, FEMAP, ZONAIR, etc.),* Must have a current DOD Secret Clearance. * Experience in leading aircraft analysis teams. Preferred Qualifications: * Master's degree in Aerospace Engineering from an accredited university. * 20+ years of work experience in the area of aircraft loads, aeroelasticity, and structural dynamics. * A demonstrated working knowledge of analysis codes (FEMAP, NASTRAN, PATRAN, ZONAIR, ZAERO, and MATLAB). A working knowledge CAD applications (CATIA / NX) is desirable. * Advanced knowledge of detailed flight loads, ground loads, miscellaneous loads, dynamics loads, fatigue spectra, flight and ground testing, flutter and aeroelasticity analyses. * Participation in multiple design and analysis cycles in aircraft development programs. * Current DOD Secret and SAP/SAR clearances. * Excellent verbal and written communication skills, be skilled in use of the Microsoft Office software suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Northrop Grumman Mission Systems is seeking a Engineering Manager 1 to join the Network Engineering Team for the Counter-Rocket Artillery and Mortar (C-RAM) Program. This position will be located in Huntsville, AL. The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Fires C2 Business unit, engaged in systems and network engineering for our cutting edge programs. Exercises considerable latitude in determining technical objectives of assignment while leading teams in the development of designs and network planning as well as the implementation and validation of network communication systems. Work is performed without appreciable direction. Identifies, documents, and communicates requirements for integrating new and legacy systems into existing architectures. Develop and conduct testing of network designs including the identification of risks and potential mitigations. Supports the investigation, documentation, and communication of hardware/software selections as well as identifying implementation techniques and tools for the most efficient solution to meet business needs, including present and future capacity requirements. Evaluate and report on new communications technologies to enhance capabilities of the network. Maintain solid technical expertise in all areas of network and computer hardware and software interconnection and interfacing, such as routers, switches and firewalls. This position's standard work schedule is a 9/80. The 9/80 schedule allows employees who work a nine-hour day Monday through Thursday to take every other Friday off. Preferred Qualifications:  * Experience leading and/or managing significant engineering tasks strongly preferred.  * Past experience building and maintaining teams, including participation in the hiring processes and contributing to performance reviews.  * Past experience in the military or working on assignment in a deployed environment.  * Experience working with military and/or overseas technical team members.  * Master's Degree in Engineering or related field preferred as is familarity with Army tactical C2 systems and active CCNP or equivalent certifications. Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems Sector, Systems Survivability Directorate is seeking an Aeroacoustics Engineer 2 with Aeroacoustics/Acoustic Engineering experience to join our nimble, involved, and experienced team. This position will be located in Redondo Beach, California. Northrop Grumman Systems Survivability specializes in the research, design, development, and testing of signature reduction technologies for aircraft systems. In particular, Aeroacoustics Engineering focuses on the aural detection of aircraft as it relates to susceptibility and mission effectiveness. Network Security Engineer responsible for providing thought leadership and subject matter expertise around a wide range of cybersecurity technologies. Candidate to lead a small team or shift for collaborative cyberspace defense. Candidate to perform Computer Network Defense (CND) Protection scanning analysis of network vulnerability scan (VS) results; determine impacts to network ops; provide recommended mitigation activities to Local Control Centers (LCC), review corrective/mitigation actions; coordinate reports and assist in risk analysis. Candidate must coordinate with other engineers of different teams to corroborate findings and create solutions for better network security and defense. Candidate must be well versed in advanced engineering and administration of network security devices; to include research, evaluation, development, and implementation of network security solutions to meet DoD standards and best practices. Candidate will use HBSS, prepare alerts and warnings for ISSM, respond to malware reports, and assist in implementing measures. Candidate will organize and manage the IAVM program to include dissemination, monitoring, and tracking IAVM notifications to ISSMs; review IAVM Plans of Action and Milestones and provide technical assistance. Candidate will interpret higher headquarters' guidance to assist in the development/maintenance of policies and procedures, while evaluating new and existing security technologies; develop, review and update cyberspace defense and incident management procedures, Operating Instructions, internal processes, and other MDA CERT/CSP documentation. Maintain knowledge of applicable DOD Cybersecurity policies, regulations and compliance documents specifically related to MDA assets. The candidate must be available to work shifts in a 24-hour operations center to include nights, weekends and holidays.
