Job Description At Northrop Grumman we develop cutting-edge technology that preserves freedom and advances human discovery. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We continue to innovate with developments from launching the first commercial flight to space, to discovering the early beginnings of the universe. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history. The Systems Integration, Test and Evaluation Organization (SIT&E) within the Aerospace Systems Engineering and Global Product Development (E&GPD) organization have multiple openings for qualified applicants in the area of Flight Test Aircrew. SIT&E is responsible for manufacturing and assembly of space vehicle subsystems; assembly, integration and test of spacecraft buses and payloads; laboratory, ground and flight test of manned and unmanned aircraft; design, development and operations of aircraft System Integration Labs and both aircraft and spacecraft environmental labs; and the design and build of test instrumentation and data systems. It is our job to make sure our cutting edge products are ready to deploy to our customers and complete their missions. To this end, we employ Test Engineers, Test Conductors, Test Directors, Technicians, Design Engineers, Software Engineers, Data/Instrumentation Engineers, Manufacturing Engineers, Network Engineers, System Administrators, Test Pilots, Unmanned Aircraft System (UAS) Pilots, Weapons/Sensor Operators, and Mission Planners at operating locations in Rancho Bernardo, Redondo Beach, El Segundo, Palmdale, Edwards AFB, Mojave, Pt Mugu, and Sunnyvale, CA; Melbourne and St Augustine, FL; Warner Robins, GA; Baltimore, Hollywood and Patuxent River, MD; Fort Worth, TX; Oklahoma City, OK; and Yuma, AZ. This requisition is for applicants interested in Flight Test Aircrew positions including Weapons System Operator and Payload Operator. Airborne test experience in flight sciences, human machine interface, cockpit/workstation evaluation, radar systems, EO-IR systems, EW systems and military mission areas are all required. Responsibilities include developing test techniques, assisting in cockpit/workstation design, working with flight test engineers creating test plans, developing test products, evaluating systems in the laboratory environment, simulation, ground test, flight test, and reporting on test results. These positions span all of our operating locations and often require travel.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * Bachelor's Degree, preferably BS in Science, Technology, Engineering or Math or with equivalent technical experience.  * 1-6 years of flight test aircrew experience required.  * Weapons Systems Operators must have at least 500 flight hours and a current Class III medical certificate  * Payload Operators must have relevant real-world experience and a current Class III medical certificate  * The ability to obtain and maintain an active DOD Secret or Top Secret clearance  Preferred Qualifications:  * Bachelor's Degree, preferably BS in Science, Technology, Engineering or Math or with equivalent technical experience.  * 1-6 years of flight test aircrew experience required.  * Weapons Systems Operators must have at least 500 flight hours and a current Class III medical certificate  * Payload Operators must have relevant real-world experience and a current Class III medical certificate  * The ability to obtain and maintain an active DOD Secret or Top Secret clearance Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. This position reports of the Director of Mission Systems Engineering and will manage the Systems Engineering department supporting the Northrop Grumman Corporation Mission Systems Sector Space IS&R Division. This is a dual-role manager position, involving both overall management of a Mission Systems Engineering section (comprising several groups), and performance of individual productive work on a program or several programs. This section manager will also be expected to perform productive (direct-charge) work on programs. It is anticipated that given the size of this section, the split between functional and program duties will be approximately 50/50, on average. The direct program work may include technical work, IPT leadership (on smaller programs, given the 50% availability), consulting, proposal support, or any other appropriate technical function. This position manages a function within the larger organizational unit, setting & operating to objectives and providing guidance to subordinates based on goals, objectives and company policy. Manager responsibilities include: staffing and workload forecasting, departing budget planning, risk management, project performance addressing cost, schedule, technical quality for related Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) elements on a large system development-type contract, support and adherence to standard Systems Engineering processes, employee engagement, mentoring and career development, including training and identification and training of skills required to execute on programs. The responsibilities include the recruiting, sourcing, onboarding, and contract maintenance for the contractors working in the business area. Additionally, this position exerts influence in the development of overall objectives and long-range goals of the Mission Systems Engineering organization. For programs and proposals, this position performs technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems. Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal. This position is responsible for ensuring the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints. This position performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications. This position requires a multi-disciplined knowledge in areas related to engineering including systems design, hardware, software and firmware design, integration and test. Applicant will interface with multiple disciplines including customers, internal executive management, program management, hardware, software and system engineering, procurement, suppliers, and manufacturing. In addition, the applicant must be able to lead, and report progress for requirements documentation, technical risk management, key system performance parameters, lessons learned, and cost and schedule performance (EVMS). The successful candidate will clearly demonstrate strong leadership skills and will have a track record as an effective communicator and problem solver who is able to develop and maintain good working relationships with internal and external stakeholders. The Systems Engineering Manager will demonstrate a broad skill set that is balanced between interpersonal, business, and technical capabilities. She / he will have an ability to operate in a team environment and collaborate across the sector business areas as required to accomplish the team goals. The selected candidate will work closely with the Directors and Managers of other engineering disciplines, Program Directors and Program Managers.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  Typical Minimum Education / Experience: 15 Years with Bachelors in Engineering or closely related discipline or ; 13 Years with Masters in Engineering or closely related discipline ; 7 Years with PhD in Engineering or close related discipline. Candidates must have relevant leadership experience in the engineering, manufacturing or logistics discipline, and/or relevant leadership experience with development and/or production program execution for space applications. The candidates must have management experience and demonstrated leadership skills. The candidate must have the ability to work effectively in a team environment, and possess strong communication and presentation skills. High proficiency in technical problem solving, to include decomposition, root cause analysis, solution development, implementation and monitoring. The candidate must have experience in design, development, implementation, or operation of Spacecraft or Space Payloads. US Citizenship and Active top-secret clearance is required.  Preferred Qualifications:  Active TS/SCI with counterintelligence polygraph. RF, RADAR, and/or Electro-Optical development and implementation experience for Space applications. Ensure that each functional organizations planning is complete, consistent and realistic, considering manpower, skills, tooling and facilities consistent with that of other functional organizations and properly supported by the resources of each participating organization. Anticipate customer needs and develops strategies to fulfill those needs and or realign customers' expectations. Functional management in the Propulsion and Power Generation Engineering (PPGE) Department responsible for the management of system/project engineers and Program Engineering Managers who provide systems engineering process/design support and management of PPGE production and development programs. Northrop Grumman Information Systems sector is seeking a Production Test Technician 1 to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in San Diego, CA. Where Technology and Teamwork come together... The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Avionics and Tactical Networks (ATN) is an operating unit within the Communications division of Northrop Grumman Information Systems. ATN is located in the Rancho Carmel facility in San Diego, California. Our expertise is in delivering complex equipment to enable modern battlefields and support aviation missions. Our focus is on the world of avionics, radio and electronic warfare product applications to enable networked communications. As part of the corporation's business focus area on Communications, we are the "equipment providers." Our team of communication systems experts is developing next-generation ground radios for land forces, and our Electronic Warfare subject matter experts are creating the next generation of Improvised Explosive Device (IED) countermeasures to keep our soldiers safe when in harm's way.  .  Roles and Responsibilities:  * Sets up test apparatus and conducts tests of production assemblies and units following methods, procedures, standards, and sequences.  * Lays out and assembles units for production equipment according to designs and specifications.  * Adjusts and calibrates systems as needed.  * Modifies equipment by adding, removing, or altering components as defined by predetermined diagrams and sketches.  * Corrects malfunctions by making adjustments or replacing parts or components as directed.  * Uses hand and small power tools, and various measuring and testing devices in performing job duties.  * May monitor and verify quality in accordance with statistical process or other control procedures. ERCOMMS  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:  * High School Diploma.  * Technicians must be able to tune RF filters, switches and Power amplifiers IAW drawings, procedures and specifications.  * Must have the ability to lift heavy objects for testing purposes.  * Operate various levels of test equipment including network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, digital oscilloscopes, signal generator or frequency meters to document test results and isolate systems faults or malfunctions.  * Must be able to obtain a Secret Clearance with Special Access Permission.  Preferred Qualifications:  * May be required to work with hazardous materials, wear safety equipment and follow strict safety rules and regulations. Are you interested in expanding your career through experience and exposure, all the while supporting a mission that seeks to ensure the security and freedom of our nation and its allies? Northrop Grumman is a leading global security company providing innovative systems, products, and solutions in unmanned systems, logistics and modernization, cyber security, and C4ISR to government and commercial customers. We operate in all 50 states and 25 countries with 65,000 employees who are committed to innovation, development, and discovery. Northrop Grumman is seeking a Computer System Security Analyst 2 to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals and to assist in implementing and enforcing security requirements on their programs. The position is responsible for the design, development, and implementation of a comprehensive Information Systems Security program for multiple program efforts. Must have experience with System Security Plan development and accrediting systems in accordance with NISPOM, ICD 503, NIST 800-53 requirements, and DSS ODAA processes. Knowledge of Northrop Grumman security requirements and technical implementation knowledge of DISA STIGs considered a plus. Develop, document, and implement information systems security plans and obtain customer Approval To Operate (ATOs) in accordance with appropriate directives and customer procedures. Ensure continuous information systems security monitoring, periodic self-inspections, and completion of all corrective actions for identified findings and vulnerabilities. Perform security incident investigations and completion of all customer required cleanup/sanitization actions and written reports. This position requires excellent skills in: leadership, customer service, verbal communication, written communication, team building, and technical security experience with varying computer operating systems (i.e. Windows 7, RHEL 6, etc...). Only candidates with an active security clearance will be considered. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems sector is seeking a Cyber System Administrator 2 with Testing to join the Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation (CDM) Team. Roles & Responsibilities: The System Administrator will have a strong testing background with the following roles and responsibilities: - Perform smoke testing, integration testing, regression testing, and formal qualification testing in an agile software development environment. - Document software problems and verify fixes. - Design, develop, and maintain software test plans, software test cases, software test procedures, and automated software tests in compliance with program functional, technical, and performance requirements. - Work with the lead test engineer and a team of cyber systems engineers to establish and develop test methods and techniques. - Troubleshoot and modify test tools and test scripts. - Generate software test data, perform test data analysis, and develop test documentation. - Participate in formal software inspection process, customer meetings, and user events. - Provide support to customer testers during acceptance testing, including test procedure walkthroughs, documentation of testing issues and test results, and answering questions on system functionality. - Perform root cause analysis to determine defect cause. - Maintain requirements traceability matrix linking test cases to the requirements verified issues and test results, and answering questions on system functionality. - Perform root cause analysis to determine defect cause. Maintain requirements traceability matrix linking test cases to the requirements verified and test results. Preferred Qualifications:  Familiarity with one or more of the following applications and concepts; Splunk, Scripting language, APIs, BigFix, McAfee, Forescout, TripWire, RES, Tenable. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems sector is seeking a Software Configuration Analyst 2/3 to join the Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation (CDM) Team. The Configuration Management (CM) Analyst is responsible for the planning, identifying, controlling, and tracking of a product's configuration from its inception throughout its life. He/she will oversee development and tagging of release packages and facilitate delivery of release packages to internal and external Deployment Engineering teams. He/she will also act as the communications bridge between Engineering and other key aspects of the business. Develops and maintains software configuration management tools to support configuration identification, control, reporting, and delivery of both internally developed and externally purchased commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) software products. Performs configuration management and release engineering tasks to ensure new software product operating parameters are documented, comply with standard hardware configurations, and are logistically sustainable. May design, develop, automate, configure and maintain configuration management and productivity tools using programming, database or scripting languages to improve software modeling and development. Designs and implements build procedures that are used to support software and systems development and use. Northrop Grumman Information Systems is looking for a Senior Applications and Storage Engineer to join our team of qualified individuals to provide technical expertise in design, development, and deployment of applications software and Storage solutions. This position requires a highly motivated, self-reliant team player who is comfortable with managing multiple tasks and responsibilities. This position will be located in Fairfax, VA. The System Engineering candidate will be responsible for a wide variety of tasks to support the program to include day-to-day system administration of Storage solutions; monitoring and maintaining the current infrastructure on various networks; supporting the installation of software upgrades; and assisting with maintaining data quality and reliability as well as patch updates. The potential candidate requires previous experience as an administrator of NetApp Storage Solutions. System Administration tasking will include building, configuring, installing, maintaining , diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing and debugging NetApp products. Canidate will be responsible for maintaining Storage operating systems, Data ONTAP or E-Series Operating System (EOS), as well as troubleshooting NetApp hardware issues. The candidate will be responsible for applying Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGS) to the servers and shelves; work with the security team to create exceptions and provide backup documentation for configurations applied. The candidate should have experience working in a team environment, demonstrate the ability to work independently, and possess the ability to work and communicate with a team to train and document the systems that they maintain. The potential candidate should have a background in the following engineering principles:  * NFS - file sharing protocol  * CIFS - file sharing protocol  * SAN connectivity methodologies for storage systems  * TCP/IP and Networking  * RAID  * LUN Management Responsibilities include:  * Implementation Support - Design, plan, and set up applications and storage in a Unix/Linux and Windows NetApp SAN environment (disk layout, RAID levels, etc.) to ensure performance and data availability.  * Application Maintenance - Apply required updates and patches and support failover.  * Performance Management - Monitor and tune system to achieve optimum performance levels, and provide reports to support SLA and other metrics collection.  * Help Desk Assistance - Address help desk requests for incident resolution, problem determination, and root cause analysis of applications and storage related issues causing outage or performance degradation.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:  * Position requires a current Top Secret clearance. In addition, individual must be able to pass a DHS background investigation.  * Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field with 9+ years of related experience or equivalent experience.  * Experience with Microsoft Windows Server and Unix/Linux system administration.  * Strong knowledge of Windows and Unix/Linux shell scripting, including PowerShell and Perl.  * Good knowledge of LAN/WAN architecture, TCP/IP, firewall/VLAN configuration, hardware-based load balancing, encryption, and network security best practices.  * Experience with configuring NetApp SAN environment and implementing NAS protocols.  * Experience with applications in a VM and NetApp Fibre Channel/SAN environment.  * Demonstrated skills in solving problems and able to work collaboratively within a team or independently.  * Strong oral and written communication skills. Are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry-leading company whose work with cutting-edge technology is driven by something human: the lives our technology protects? Northrop Grumman Technology Services is seeking a Database Administrator to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals in transforming the future of technology and public health. This position will be located in Atlanta, GA and will become part of Northrop Grumman's team that supports the Centers for Disease Control. It's not the systems that drive us: it's the soldier our systems bring home. It's not just the equipment that motivates us: it's the people our equipment protects. It's not the innovation that gets us up in the morning: it's whom those innovations serve. We're united by our work to help people and protect the world. And that mission makes our team even stronger. When you join Northrop Grumman, you'll have the opportunity to connect with coworkers in an environment that's uniquely caring, diverse, and respectful. Employees share experiences, insights, perspectives, and creative solutions with some of the best minds in the industry. We collaborate through integrated product teams, cross-functional teams, and employee resource groups, while thriving through the support of training and development, mentors and every day coaching, along with extensive health and work/life benefits. We're committed to our employees' professional and personal development and success. Northrop Grumman recruits top talent with traditional and non-traditional backgrounds in order to ensure our team is united, connected, skilled, focused and innovative. An inclusive workplace of people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives is the key to our performance. At Northrop Grumman, we want our employees to bring their whole self to work. Northrop Grumman is seeking an Operations Research Analyst 2 to support our JDPAC team in Scott AFB, IL. Responsibilities: - Applies operations research, statistical, mathematical, and analytical techniques related to deployment, mobility and distribution modeling and regression analysis. - Serves as a team analyst in the Joint Distribution Process Analysis Center (JDPAC) at USTRANSCOM responsible for reviewing and developing models and methods to support distribution and supply chain activities within the Department of Defense. - Performs data consolidation, cleansing and analysis, and presents data from one or more source systems. - Data analysis may include complex algorithmic design solutions and the development of relational database solutions to combine data and analysis from multiple systems. Specific task will involve performing and assessing model runs in support of the Enterprise Executable Plan (EEP) used during the Agile Transportation for the 21st Century (AT-21) Optimized Delivery (OD) support for the JDPAC and the Directorate of Operations. Tasks also involve creating and maintaining utility tools to assist analyst in performing assigned tasks. Candidate must be familiar with the AT-21 optimized delivery process. Northrop Grumman is seeking an Enterprise Storage & Backup Administrator to join our team of qualified diverse individuals. This position can be performed virtually, and is not location specific. Transforming the future of technology... The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Enterprise Compute Storage & Network (ECSN) organization supporting the International spaces. AMER, (America's) EMEA (Europe,Middle East, Africa, and APAC (Asia,Pacific, Japan). Candidates must be willing to work a 2nd and/or 3rd shift. Roles & Responsibilities: Candidate will be supporting structured & unstructured data storage in an enterprise environment. (i.e Unified VNX) Candidate should have a medium-range system-administrator-level skills of TSM, Data Domain, Windows 2008/2012, ESX 5.x and the equivalent skills of any UNIX/Linux RHEL operating systems and their backup client application. (i.e. TSM, Avamar) Candidate will provision and fulfill storage allocations, manage TSM, Data Domain, conduct data replication tasks (EMC Recoverpoint), implement storage & backup solutions for standard and/or customized environments, possibly involving equipment and software from several vendors, monitor, maintain, and manage an established enterprise data storage & backup environment, plan and implement data migration and management tasks, create scripts or develop simple customized tools to manage a heterogeneous environment, compile data storage and backup performance metrics, operate and maintain EMC, VNX, Data Domain, RecoverPoint , IBM Tivoli (TSM) environments. Candidate must be able work with peer organizations in support of the International customer. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems Sector is seeking a GFC/C Maintenance Manager 1 to join our team in Fort Greeley, AK. The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Ground Based Midcourse Defense (GMD) Development and Sustainment Contract (DSC) in support of the Missile Defense Agency. The GMD element, composed of the Ground Systems (GS) and Ground Based Interceptor (GBI) components, is a critical part of our nation's layered Ballistic Missile Defense System providing the U.S. with the capability to engage and intercept long range ballistic missiles during midcourse flight. The GS component provides the capability to process data received from radars and overhead sensors, communicate across a complex network of redundant nodes, interact with the Warfighter, compute intercept solutions, and command and direct the GBI to intercept. Position Description: - Responsible for the daily maintenance activities of the GFC/C maintainers, including System Admins, Field Engineers and CTSC/Harris sub-contractors. - Provides technical advice and guidance on installation, adaptation, configuration or enhancement of company technical products, programs and systems. - Provides expertise for resolving technical problems, troubleshoots product and coordinates modifications to product in accordance with customer requirements. - Work will be done at customer site. Responsible for ensuring the NG site manager and the NG Operations managers are kept informed of maintenance activities that affect the site. - Work to be performed at Ft. Greely, AK. - Position requires occasional travel and internal military and customer interface. - Candidate needs to be able to demonstrate the ability to effectively communicate with a variety of military and government customers and prime contractor.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  - To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below;* Bachelors Degree in a STEM, Technical or IT discipline or related field with 6 years of related experience.  * Active Secret Clearance and ability to get a Top Secret Security Clearance.  * CompTIA certification meeting DoD 8570 requirements.  * Experience with UNIX operating systems.  * Experience with Windows operating systems.  * Knowledge of maintenance practices and logistics.  * Strong work ethic, demonstrated problem solving ability, willingness to learn new skills, and proactive approach.  * Ability to lead a diverse team of maintenance personnel.  * Strong skills in creating and following documented processes and checklists.  Preferred Qualifications:  - Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:- Knowledge of Military command, control and communication systems.- Experience working with Sun Solaris platforms.- Process, Mission, Procedure and Checklist oriented.- Experience as a maintainer and familiar with logistics and use of the MMICS database.- SUN/IBM System Administrator experience a plus.- Experience in communications equipment/GFC/C log file analysis.- Familiarity with missile defense programs, GMD Communications network functionality and GMD Fire Control / Communications functionality. How do cyber terrorists get past the industries best? They don't. There are too many of us fighting virtual threats, protecting enterprises and entire countries from large-scale attacks. From creating a citywide wireless network for our first responders, to protecting our nation from cyber threats, to building software-defined radios that change how our military communications, our Information Systems team helps life run smoothly and safely. If you are the sort of person who loves a challenge and likes to be involved in serious organizational and software change  -- Then what is happening in the Cyber and Intelligence Mission Solutions Division is the place for you. This is without a doubt one of the most interesting and exciting times to join an organization like ours. The culture is one of excellence; team work, learning, delivered value and people. We are looking for people who love to learn and take initiative to really make this happen. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems is seeking a Principal Cyber System Engineer 6 to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals located at Annapolis Junction, MD. Description of Position: Work as a System Engineer in the design and development of Next Generation SIGINT architecture. This position is focused on the end-to-end engineering of interfaces, both internal and external, and architectural level system engineering activities. Work will also include definition and management of system requirements, CONOPs and verification and validation activities. The preferred candidate should be able to work and function in a dynamic environment where requirements can change according to the customer needs. Candidate should be skilled in Agile Process Framework and be able to contribute to daily Scrums. As one of the most senior technical experts on the team, you will, interface directly with users and customers providing foresight and technical guidance aimed at satisfying mission needs. As a key contributor to the success of the program, you will collaborate with software and systems engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of complex software systems. You will provide technical leadership to the software development team and work complex technical tasks under general guidance from the team lead. As a Principal Engineer on this program, you will be asked to mentor and facilitate the development of junior engineers who join. Additionally, you will interact with senior company management and customers, responsible for generating white papers and innovative solutions for program growth and will be responsible to convey new techniques and technologies to the analytic workforce. Our professionals live and breathe different perspectives here; we are curious about the world, accepting of each other, and well aware that the more ideas, backgrounds, opinions, and experiences we bring to our work, the stronger that work will be. Northrop Grumman National Resilience (NR) Operating Unit (OU) is seeking highly talented Senior Communications Network Engineer to serve as a dynamic technical partner responsible for the build out, maintenance, and support of IT and network infrastructure efforts for a U.S. Government customer located in Annapolis Junction, Maryland. This is an exciting opportunity to support the OU's newest mission partner, which entails a large IDIQ contract that is focused on developing technical solutions in the areas of Cryptographic Transformation, Cyber Engineering, Active Cyber Defense (ACD), and Infrastructure Modernization to ensure the safe delivery of critical information to the right people. This position will be focused on engineering, design, architecture, installation, configuration, and maintenance support for LAN/CAN/WAN efforts. This delivery order's scope covers both IT and network infrastructure. The Senior Communications Network Engineer will be expected to work independently to solve complex technical problems and have experience working with system administrators and communication network engineers of the program. You will interface directly with users and customers providing foresight and technical guidance aimed at satisfying mission and organizational needs. As a key contributor to the success of the program, you will collaborate in the planning, design, implementation, and maintenance of communications networks to include LAN, CAN, WAN, etc. You will provide technical subject matter expertise to the customer and team members. Additionally, you will interact with senior company management and customers, provide innovative solutions for program growth and will be responsible to convey new techniques and technologies to the mission.  Roles and Responsibilities:  The ideal candidate will maintain smooth operation of LAN, WAN, CAN, and Voice and Video requirements. The candidate will plan, evaluate, and coordinate installation and/or reconfiguration of hardware and software elements of data and/or voice communication network. They will maintain technical expertise in all areas of networks and computer hardware and software interconnection and interfacing, such as routers, multiplexers, firewalls, hubs, bridges, gateways, etc. They may propose solutions to management to ensure all communications requirements based on future needs and current usage, configuring such solutions to optimize cost savings. They will prepare or ensure that appropriate network documentation exists, including operational instructions. They will provide regular monitoring and network analysis regarding short- and long-range planning for in-house systems. Candidates may coordinate third-party maintenance for network equipment, and may design network or portion of network that include selection of hardware and software packages. This position may be filled at a higher grade based on the qualifications listed below.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications for a Level 3:  * Five (5) years experience with a Bachelor's degree (or 9 years experience in lieu of a degree) in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field.  * Candidate must possess an active CCNA, Security+, and ITLv3 certification.  * Experience providing support in the translation of business requirements into telecommunications (e.g., LAN, CAN, WAN, Voice and Video) requirements, designs and orders.  * Experience providing in-depth engineering analysis of telecommunications alternatives for government agencies.  * Experience providing interface support to telecommunications end users, telecommunications operations personnel, and telecommunications strategic program management.  * Proven ability to integrate real-time communication services (e.g. SMS, presence information, IP telephony, video conferencing, and data sharing).  * Experience deploying, troubleshooting and maintaining CISCO.  * Experience developing technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity.  * Excellent communication skills to include speaking and writing.  * Current TS/SCI w/Poly is required. Basic Qualifications for a Level 4:  * Nine (9) years experience with a Bachelor's degree (or 13 years experience in lieu of a degree) in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field.  * Candidate must possess an active CCNA, Security+, and ITLv3 certification.  * Experience providing support in the translation of business requirements into telecommunications (e.g., LAN, CAN, WAN, Voice and Video) requirements, designs and orders.  * Experience providing in-depth engineering analysis of telecommunications alternatives for government agencies.  * Experience providing interface support to telecommunications end users, telecommunications operations personnel, and telecommunications strategic program management.  * Proven ability to integrate real-time communication services (e.g. SMS, presence information, IP telephony, video conferencing, and data sharing).  * Experience deploying, troubleshooting and maintaining CISCO.  * Experience developing technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity.  * Excellent communication skills to include speaking and writing.  * Current TS/SCI w/Poly is required.  Preferred Qualifications:  * Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.  * An active CCNP certification.  * Experience serving as the network technical advisor to a customer in long-range customer planning concerning IT and lab network infrastructure, environments, and enclaves that adheres to ISO 9000 requirements and other DoD/IC regulations.  * Experience providing technical support to the Network Administrators and System Administrators, monitoring and maintaining network infrastructure, improving system performance, and automating system administration.  * Experience providing input to the design of the organizational networks and mission architecture to include configuration and maintenance of the organization's network diagrams and accreditations. Northrop Grumman National Resilience (NR) Operating Unit (OU) is seeking a highly talented Senior Software Engineer to serve as a dynamic technical point of contact of a team supporting smart data and trusted data format development and integration efforts for a U.S. Government customer located in Annapolis Junction, Maryland. This is an exciting opportunity to support the OU's newest mission partner, which entails a large IDIQ contract that is focused on developing technical solutions in the areas of Cryptographic Transformation, Cyber Engineering, Active Cyber Defense (ACD), and Infrastructure Modernization to ensure the safe delivery of critical information to the right people. This position will be focused on software development efforts of a delivery order that supports agile development and operations and maintenance of secure data wrappers in a TDF. This will enable data-centric security in a multi-agency cloud environment. The Software Engineer is a senior engineer of the team; you will interface directly with users and customers providing foresight and technical guidance aimed at satisfying mission needs. As a contributor to the success of the program, you will collaborate with software and systems engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of complex software systems. Responsibilities will include mentoring and facilitating the development of junior engineers. Additionally, you will interact with senior company management and customers, provide innovative solutions for program growth and will be responsible to convey new techniques and technologies to the mission.  Roles and Responsibilities:  The ideal candidate will design, develop, document, test and debug applications software and systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions. Conduct multidisciplinary research and collaborate with equipment designers and/or hardware engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software. Determines computer user needs; analyzes system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls; prepares operating instructions; designs and develops compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems. Ensures software standards are met. To be considered the candidate must be able to support the following: The individual must be able to communicate directions and provide guidance to junior programmer/analysts, as required and have extensive experience in planning and accomplishing goals and complicated tasks and providing technical guidance on complex projects as a technical point of contact.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * Nine (9) + years' experience with a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related engineering field.  * Experience guiding the successful completion of major programs, with the added experience to function in a project leadership role.  * Experience serving as a prime technical contact to customer in long-range company planning concerning new or projected areas of technological research and advancements.  * Extensive Java and XML experience is required to include writing and customizing XML validation rules using XSLT, ability to read, create, and edit XML schemas, and experience with Java and open source XML streaming libraries and related libraries (javax.xml.stream, woodstox, staxmate, open-exi, aalto, xerces, saxon).  * Three-tier architecture experience and expertise is necessary.  * Understanding of the SMP and CAPCO classification systems on which TDF security metadata is based.  * Excellent communication skills to include speaking and writing.  * Current TS/SCI w/Poly is required.  Preferred Qualifications:  * Master's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering.  * Experience with Agile development process.  * Experience with data-centric security and data tagging.  * Experience working with encryption, digital signing, and cryptographic binding.  * Knowledge of Schematron and TDF (and related specifications) business rules.  * Understanding of OSGi specification.  * Experience with the specifications and business rules of the TDF. Northrop Grumman National Resilience (NR) Operating Unit (OU) is seeking highly talented Senior Network Engineer to serve as a dynamic technical partner responsible for the build out, maintenance, and support of IT and network infrastructure efforts for a U.S. Government customer located in Annapolis Junction, Maryland. This is an exciting opportunity to support the OU's newest mission partner, which entails a large IDIQ contract that is focused on developing technical solutions in the areas of Cryptographic Transformation, Cyber Engineering, Active Cyber Defense (ACD), and Infrastructure Modernization to ensure the safe delivery of critical information to the right people. This position will be focused on engineering, design, architecture, installation, configuration, and maintenance support for both labs and development/test efforts. This delivery order's scope covers both IT and network infrastructure. The Senior Network Engineer will be expected to work independently to solve complex technical problems and have experience working with system administrators and communication network engineers of the program. You will interface directly with users and customers providing foresight and technical guidance aimed at satisfying mission and organizational needs. As a key contributor to the success of the program, you will collaborate in the planning, design, implementation, and maintenance of IT infrastructure, networks, and labs. You will provide technical subject matter expertise to the customer and team members. Additionally, you will interact with senior company management and customers, provide innovative solutions for program growth and will be responsible to convey new techniques and technologies to the mission.  Roles and Responsibilities:  The ideal candidate will design and plan network communications systems. They will provide specifications and detailed schematics for network architecture. Also will provide specific detailed information for hardware and software selection, implementation techniques and tools for the most efficient solution to meet business needs, including present and future capacity requirements. Will conduct testing of network design. Will maintain technical expertise in all areas of network and computer hardware and software interconnection and interfacing, such as routers, multiplexers, firewalls, hubs, bridges, gateways, etc. Candidates will evaluate and report on new communications technologies to enhance capabilities of the network.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * Ten (10) + years' experience with a Bachelor's degree in Network Engineering or related technical field.  * Candidate must possess an active CCNP certification.  * Experience serving as the network technical advisor to a customer in long-range customer planning concerning IT and lab network infrastructure, environments, and enclaves that adheres to ISO 9000 requirements and other DoD/IC regulations.  * Experience providing technical support to the Network Administrators and System Administrators, monitoring and maintaining network infrastructure, improving system performance, and automating system administration.  * Experience providing input to the design of the organizational networks and mission architecture to include configuration and maintenance of the organization's network diagrams and accreditations.  * Experience conducting Computer Network Defense Operations, installing network upgrades, instrumenting network design, and performing network quality assurance and control.  * Experience developing technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity.  * Excellent communication skills to include speaking and writing.  * Current TS/SCI w/Poly is required.  Preferred Qualifications:  * Master's degree in related field.  * Certifications in CCNA, SEC+, and ITILv3.  * Experience providing support in the translation of business requirements into telecommunications (e.g., LAN, CAN, WAN, Voice and Video) requirements designs and orders. Northrop Grumman Corporation is a leading global security company providing innovative systems, products, and solutions in unmanned systems, cybersecurity, C4ISR, and logistics and modernization to government and commercial customers worldwide. Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) was selected by the U.S. Missile Defense Agency to participate on the Missile Defense National Team. This team was chartered to develop a Ballistic Missile Defense System for the United States. Missile Defense and Protective Systems (MDPS) serves as Northrop Grumman Mission Systems' focal point for all activities associated with missile defense, including Command, Control, Battle Management and Communications (C2BMC), simulation & modeling, systems engineering, and target discrimination. Successful candidate must possess the ability to technically diagnose, mitigate/troubleshoot issues, and contribute to an on-site team providing 24x7 support to the C2BMC application suites that are globally dispersed in different time zones. Candidate must have strong background in Server System Administration and troubleshooting analysis in some or all of the following platforms: Linux, UNIX, Windows servers, Windows clients. Candidate will lead or participate in system/networking troubleshooting, problem resolution and maintenance activities, to include on-site and/or telephonic maintenance support. Furthermore, candidate will serve as C2BMC application subject matter experts providing Level 2 troubleshooting, break fix and preventative maintenance actions, which involved interaction with remote C2BMC sites and different levels of leadership within the C2BMC Command Center. Candidate must be a self-starting problem solver, capable of planning, coordinating, directing and controlling their individual projects, and possess the capability to work with limited supervision and lead trouble shooting to resolution. Performs other related duties and assignments as required. Highly skilled in System Administration and Application to ensure uptime, performance, resources and security of the system is sustained and anomalies are fixed efficiently. Sound knowledge and practical experience to direct the assessment and development of Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTPs) and/or Operating Instructions (OIs) to effectively administer, operate and manage services under C2BMC operational control. Proficiency in Microsoft Visio, Project, Word, PowerPoint and/or Excel. Knowledge of modern computer systems, client/server, LAN/WAN and Network concepts, modern network management and monitoring concepts. Knowledge and proficiency in technical writing. Position is normally Mon- Fri: may require on-call, evening and weekend support during system anomalies and or tests. Desired Skills: Previous experience and sound knowledge of C2BMC System or Missile Defense. Scripting on Linux, UNIX or Windows servers and Windows Workstation. Did you know that Northrop Grumman's Advanced Technology Lab is developing a new family of superconducting digital logic known as Reciprocal Quantum Logic (RQL)? On a gate for gate basis, RQL consumes five orders of magnitude less power than CMOS while running at significantly higher clock speeds. Having demonstrated its performance with basic circuits, we are now developing processors, memories, and larger systems. We are seeking an Analog/Mixed Signal Integrated Circuit Designer who will be responsible for the design and layout of superconducting integrated circuits to support the development of Northrop Grumman's patented RQL circuit family. You will use your skills as an Integrated Circuit designer while learning about superconducting circuit design. Tasks will include schematic creation, circuit simulation, manual layout, verification (Layout vs. Schematic and Design Rule Checking), and parasitic extraction for a variety of superconducting circuits. The right candidate will be comfortable in a dynamic environment with rapidly developing technologies and tools. Verilog-A or Verilog-AMS and electronics test lab experience are a plus.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * Bachelor's degree in a technical area with 14 years of relevant experience (12 years with a technical MS or with 9 a technical PhD) *5 years of experience in Integrated Circuit design with at least 2 years of experience in Analog/Mixed Signal Integrated Circuit design *Experience with some of the following: IC custom design tools (e.g. Cadence or Mentor) for schematic capture, circuit simulation, and full custom layout; mixed-signal circuit design experience (Digital and Analog); verification skills utilizing Cadence Assura *Able to obtain and maintain a Secret clearance  Preferred Qualifications:  *Advanced Degree- either MS or PhD *Current Secret clearance *Experience performing chip level integration *Strong design automation skills *Experience with analog behavioral modeling *Electronics test lab experience *Experience with low-temperature experimental measurements, microwave engineering Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. Northrop Grumman National Resilience (NR) Operating Unit (OU) is seeking a highly talented software engineers to serve as contributors of a team supporting smart data and trusted data format development and integration efforts for a U.S. Government customer located in Annapolis Junction, Maryland. This is an exciting opportunity to support the OU's newest mission partner, which entails a large IDIQ contract that is focused on developing technical solutions in the areas of Cryptographic Transformation, Cyber Engineering, Active Cyber Defense (ACD), and Infrastructure Modernization to ensure the safe delivery of critical information to the right people. This position will be focused on software development efforts of a delivery order that supports agile development and operations and maintenance of secure data wrappers in a TDF. This will enable data-centric security in a multi-agency cloud environment. The Software Engineer will provide foresight and technical expertise aimed at satisfying mission needs. As a contributor to the success of the program, you will collaborate with senior software and systems engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of complex software systems.  Roles and Responsibilities:  The ideal candidate will design, develop, document, test and debug applications software and systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions. Conduct multidisciplinary research and collaborate with equipment designers and/or hardware engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software. Determines computer user needs; analyzes system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls; prepares operating instructions; designs and develops compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems. Ensures software standards are met. This requisition may be filled at a higher grade based on qualifications listed below.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  This requisition may be filled at either a level 2 or a level 3. Level 2 you must possess two (2) Years of relevant experience with Bachelors in Science; 0 Years with Masters. In lieu of degree four (4) additional years of relevant experience will be considered. Level 3 you must possess five (5) Years of relevant experience with Bachelors in Science; three (3) Years with Masters. In lieu of degree four (4) additional years of relevant experience will be considered.  * Three (3) + years' experience with a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related engineering field.  * One (1) year experience with agile development and associated processes.  * Experience executing the successful completion of project milestones.  * Experience providing solutions to a variety of technical problems of increasing scope and complexity as assigned.  * Java and/or XML experience is required to include writing and customizing XML validation rules using XSLT, ability to read, create, and edit XML schemas, and experience with some Java and open source XML streaming libraries and related libraries (javax.xml.stream, woodstox, staxmate, open-exi, aalto, xerces, saxon).  * Excellent communication skills to include speaking and writing.  Preferred Qualifications:  * Master's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering.  * Knowledge of the Trusted Data Format (TDF) business rules and the specifications.  * Understanding of the SMP and CAPCO classification systems on which TDF security metadata is based.  * Experience working with encryption, digital signing, and cryptographic binding.  * Current TS/SCI w/Poly is desired, but not required. Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems sector is seeking a Cable & Electrical Design Engineer 4 to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in Azusa, CA. Put your years of experience into a future of excellence. The successful applicant will be assigned to perform cable design and analysis. The position requires coordination with System Engineering, Mechanical Design Engineering, Part Material & Process Engineering, Manufacturing and Mission Assurance to ensure that the product meets requirements. Northrop Grumman Military/Civil Space Mission Operations specializes in support for on-orbit operational sensor payloads, including monitoring, trending, and analysis of state of health and mission performance and mission capabilities, including data analysis and end-to-end system interface testing. The team is seeking an innovative and motivated individual to lead the Mission Operations Flight Test & Evaluation section, primarily located in the Azusa, CA facility. This position is ~20% functional organizational management of 12-15 engineering staff with a wide range of experience and skills. The selected candidate must be able to develop 80% direct contract work coverage. Previous experience with satellite or ground systems operations is strongly preferred. This position requires a solid understanding of engineering test disciplines in a space systems context in order to help establish, evaluate performance, and train effective work processes and procedures. The manager may be called upon to support sensor, payload, ground, or system testing including launch readiness activities, on-orbit qualification testing, payload command product validation, anomaly investigation, and mission data analysis. The functional organization primarily supports the Space-Based Infrared Systems (SBIRS) and Missile Defense System Exerciser (MDSE) programs. SBIRS is an Overhead Persistent Infrared (OPIR) space surveillance system with several payloads on orbit and additional assets scheduled to launch over the next few years. MDSE supports the operational development and testing of both strategic and tactical missile defense systems for the Missile Defense Agency (MDA). Strong people leadership skills are required, including the ability to identify and develop staff capabilities, support career development, evaluate and manage staff performance, identify and recognize achievement, and plan staffing support for programs. The manager would also be responsible for ensuring process compliance and supporting department initiatives. Additional responsibilities may be assigned commensurate with performance or due to business needs. Northrop Grumman is seeking a Computer Systems Security Analyst (CSSA) to join the Information Systems Security (ISS) team in Annapolis, MD. The ISS team consists of Information Systems Security Officers (ISSOs) and Information Systems Security Managers (ISSMs), Information Systems Security Engineers (ISSEs), and Information Systems Security Auditors (ISAs). The selected candidate will perform one or more of these roles. The ISS organization has overall responsibility for providing security oversight to all Northrop Grumman classified systems under their respective purview. This position will perform assessments of systems and networks within the networking environment or enclave and identify where those systems and networks deviate from acceptable configurations, enclave policy, or local policy. This is achieved through passive evaluations such as compliance audits and active evaluations such as vulnerability assessments. Establishes strict program control processes to ensure mitigation of risks and supports obtaining certification and accreditation of systems. Includes support of process, analysis, coordination, security certification test, security documentation, as well as investigations, software research, hardware introduction and release, emerging technology research inspections and periodic audits. Assist in the implementation of the Risk Management Framework (RMF), through the required government policy (i.e., NISPOM, JSIG, ICD etc.), make recommendations on process tailoring, participate in and document process activities. Perform analyses to validate established security requirements and to recommend additional security requirements and safeguards. Support the formal Security Test and Evaluation (ST&E) required by each government accrediting authority through pre-test preparations, participation in the tests, analysis of the results and preparation of required reports. Document the results of Assessment and Authorization activities and technical or coordination activity and prepare the System Security Plans and update the Plan of Actions and Milestones POA&M. Periodically conduct a complete review of each system's audits and monitor corrective actions until all actions are closed. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:  * Examine potential security violations to determine if the Network Environment (NE) has been breached, assess the impact, and preserve evidence.  * Support, monitor, test, and troubleshoot hardware and software IA problems pertaining to the NE.  * Perform IA related support functions including installation, configuration, troubleshooting, assistance, and/or training, in response to agency requirements for the NE.  * Analyze patterns of non-compliance and take appropriate administrative or programmatic actions to minimize security risks and insider threats. Manage accounts, network rights, and access to NE systems and equipment.  * Analyze system performance for potential security problems. Assess the performance of IA security controls within the NE.  * Identify IA vulnerabilities resulting from a departure from the implementation plan or that were not apparent during testing.  * Configure, optimize, and test network servers, hubs, routers, and switches to ensure they comply with security policy, procedures, and technical requirements.  * Install, test, maintain, and upgrade network operating systems software and hardware to comply with IA requirements.  * Evaluate potential IA security risks and take appropriate corrective and recovery action.  * Ensure that hardware, software, data, and facility resources are archived, sanitized, or disposed of in a manner consistent with system security plans and requirements.  * Perform system audits to assess security related factors within the NE.  * Develop and implement access control lists on routers, firewalls, and other network devices.  * Install perimeter defense systems including intrusion detection systems, firewalls, grid sensors, etc., and enhance rule sets to block sources of malicious traffic.  * Implement applicable patches including IAVAs, IAVBs, and TAs for their NE.  * Adhere to IS security laws and regulations to support functional operations for the NE. Implement response actions in reaction to security incidents.  * Support Security Test and Evaluations (Part of C&A Process).  * Monitor/Manage clients firewalls and intrusion detection Systems.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications:  * Bachelor's degree in Science and 2 Years of relevant work experience; 0 Years with masters. An equivalent combination of education/experience will be considered.  * Current Top Secret/SCI and current CI polygraph, or ability to pass CI polygraph if required for position.  * IAM Level-1 Certification (CAP, GSLC or Security + CE).  Preferred Qualifications:  * Bachelor's or master's degree with a technical emphasis (e.g. Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science, EE).  * Experience with security hardening, assessment and reporting tools (SCAP, ACAS, HBSS, Nessus, XACTA)CISSP.  * CISSP.  * MCSE/RHSA and/or System Administration experience. Description:The Federal Health Operation is seeking a full time Public Health Research Team Leader to work with the Naval Health Research Center (NHRC)/Department of Defense (DoD) HIV/AIDS Prevention Program (DHAPP) and the Military HIV Research Program (MHRP)/Walter Reed Army Institute of Research (WRAIR) in San Diego, CA. This individual will support the project principal investigator and project leadership to lead a multidisciplinary team in the development, execution, and reporting phases of multiple concurrent studies of HIV/STI risk behaviors, transmission dynamics, transmission networks, and prevention among US Navy personnel and their beneficiaries. The candidate will perform literature searches, execute all research study logistics (create, submit, and maintain ethics approval documentation, coordinate and participate in planning meetings, critically review study procedure documentation, and coordinate project supplies), design data collection instruments, recruit, train, and supervise field staff, collect data, create and manage databases, analyze and summarize data, prepare reporting documents and briefing materials, and give presentations. The candidate will also supervise data management and execute a reporting and publication plan for data collected in prior similar studies of US Navy personnel. Qualifications:Qualifications: 1. Education: MD with a master?s degree in a relevant technical field (e.g. Public Health) or PhD in a relevant technical field from an accredited college or university. A Public Health degree in epidemiology is preferred. 2. Prior Work Experience: Minimum of 5-10 years of experience in health science, or in HIV/STI program execution, evaluation, or research. A demonstrated successful track record of effective leadership and scientific writing is required. Prior work with a USG Agency or the military is preferred. 3. Language Proficiency: Written and oral proficiency in English is required. Outstanding written and oral communication skills are required. The incumbent must be able to communicate effectively and accurately with all team members, USG, NGO, and government officials. Incumbent must be able to communicate effectively with remote team members. The incumbent is required to be capable of preparing documents such as background reports, ethics submissions, data tables, and progress reports. Correspondences and documents are to be prepared in a professional and competent manner requiring little or no editorial changes. 4. Knowledge: Subject matter expertise in public health practice principles, epidemiology concepts including sampling strategies for and data collection from hidden and highly stigmatized populations, research methods, quantitative and qualitative research and analysis methods, data management, HIV, and STIs is required. Familiarity with HIV/STI laboratory field data collection and initial processing, management, storage/archiving, and transfer of clinical samples is required. The incumbent should have a strong interest in working with and on behalf of the US Military and improving public health in this population. An ability to interact positively and professionally within an academic/evidence based environment and have excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills is required. 5. Travel: This position involves minimal travel, but the incumbent may be requested to travel domestically, internationally, and regionally. 6. Citizenship: Due to Federal contract regulations, US citizenship (no dual US citizenship) and the ability to obtain a Secret Clearance is required. Leidos Overview:Leidos is an applied solutions company focused on markets that are seeing converging business and technological trends, and address basic, enduring human needs:  defense and national security, health and life sciences, and energy, engineering and infrastructure. The Company's approximately 20,000 employees serve customers in the U.S. Department of Defense, the intelligence community, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, other U.S. Government civil agencies and commercial health and engineering markets. Description:The Federal Health Operation is seeking a full time Public Health Program Monitoring and Evaluation Data Analyst to work with the Naval Health Research Center (NHRC)/Department of Defense (DoD) HIV/AIDS Prevention Program (DHAPP) in San Diego, CA. This individual will support the Strategic Information Team. The purpose of this position is to strengthen the collection, management, and use of strategic information in order to monitor and improve programs supported by DHAPP. This includes providing in-person and virtual technical assistance to DHAPP partners (DHAPP field offices and partner militaries) in monitoring and evaluation (M&E), in program quality monitoring, and in the effective use of strategic information for planning and programmatic decision making, and developing M&E and other data related strategies for HIV/AIDS programs. International and domestic travel is a part of this position. The candidate will collect, organize, verify, and manage routinely reported data received from DHAPP field programs. Assist staff to analyze, interpret, and apply existing epidemiological, programmatic, and other relevant data to effectively plan future projects, allocate resources, and make informed programmatic decisions. Assist staff with understanding and applying M&E data while focusing on quality improvement of services and improving the accuracy of reported program data. This individual will work with foreign country partner programs to guide strategic information investments in order to improve the quality of delivered services. Participate in the evaluation and assessment of DHAPP programs and activities. Assist with training staff on how to best use program data, assess and improve data quality, use data management and analysis tools, and realistically set program targets. Support staff with understanding and using the Site Improvement Monitoring System (SIMS) data and the analysis of this data in order to improve program quality. The incumbent will respond to routine and ad hoc requests for information and other data reporting. Manage these data correspondence and project communications. Assist with data management and reporting requirements for SIMS site-level data. Participate in PEPFAR working groups such as those related to quality assurance, program quality improvement, monitoring and evaluation, and the Interagency Collaborative for Program Improvement. Qualifications:Qualifications: 1. Education: Minimum of a master?s degree in a relevant technical field (e.g. public health, epidemiology, quality assurance, or related field) from an accredited college or university. 2. Prior Work Experience: Minimum of two years of experience in public health M&E, international health, health science, or in HIV/STI programs. Prior work experience with a USG Agency, military, or other international/local organization is advantageous. Experience using statistical software such as SAS or SPSS is desirable. Experience with GIS software is also desirable. Experience with Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel, and Outlook is expected. Data management and analysis using Excel or Access is beneficial. 3. Language Proficiency: Written and oral proficiency in English is required. The incumbent is required to be capable of preparing documents such as technical and progress reports. Reports, correspondences, and documents are to be prepared in a professional and competent manner requiring little or no editorial changes. The ability to communicate information effectively with public health scientists and program staff is required. 4. Knowledge: Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques and practices of monitoring and/or evaluation, and data quality assessment is required. Knowledge of concepts, principles, techniques and practices of HIV/AIDS prevention, care, treatment, and support programs is desirable. An understanding and knowledge of USG regulations and procedures is beneficial. 5. Travel: The incumbent must be willing and able to travel domestically and internationally. This position is expected to require travel up to 25%. 6. Citizenship: Due to Federal contract regulations, US citizenship (no dual US citizenship) and the ability to obtain a Secret Clearance is required. 7. Other: The incumbent should have an interest in working with and on behalf of militaries. An ability to interact positively and professionally within an academic/evidence based environment and have excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills. The candidate must be able to work both independently and cooperatively in an established culturally diverse team setting. The individual will be required to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and be flexible in responding to changing demands, timelines, and priorities. The incumbent must be able and willing to work early and late hours and additional hours beyond the established 40 hour work week as sometimes necessary. Supervision Received: The Public Health Program Monitoring and Evaluation Data Analyst will work under the direction of the Strategic Information Team Leader, the NHRC/DHAPP management team, and Leidos management. The incumbent will work with a great deal of independence. S/he will establish priorities, adhere to and meet established deadlines, and perform responsibilities and duties with minimal guidance and follow up. Leidos Overview:Leidos is an applied solutions company focused on markets that are seeing converging business and technological trends, and address basic, enduring human needs: defense and national security, health and life sciences, and energy, engineering and infrastructure. The Company's approximately 20,000 employees serve customers in the U.S. Department of Defense, the intelligence community, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, other U.S. Government civil agencies and commercial health and engineering markets.  Qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply.     Leidos is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Description:The Federal Health Operation is currently seeking a Behavioral Health Researcher/ Statistician to support the Health and Behavioral Sciences Department at the Naval Health Research Center, San Diego, CA.  åÊ The successful applicant will serve two equally important roles within this department: (1) planning and executing research and development projects to promote the behavioral health of military personnel, and (2) serving as a statistician/statistical advisor on diverse and complex research studies conducted within the department.  Behavioral Health Research Expertise. The successful candidate will have an advanced degree in Psychology, Epidemiology, Public Health, Medicine, or a related field and will have demonstrated experience independently conducting empirical research on issues related to behavioral health. This position will involve developing and executing a program of research that falls within the scope of and complements the research conducted within the Health and Behavioral Sciences Department. Researchers in this department conduct research to determine factors impacting the behavioral health and adjustment of military service members as well as developing and testing interventions to improve the well-being of this population. Current research areas include substance abuse, mental health, stress reduction, interpersonal violence, risky behavior, suicidal behavior, social support, resilience, injury recovery, sleep problems, pain, and health disparities.  Statistical Expertise. Equally important as the research requirement for this position is that the candidate possess advanced knowledge and skill in conducting complex statistical analyses including multilevel modeling and structural equation modeling. In addition to conducting programmatic health research, the person obtaining this position will serve as a statistician or a statistical consultant to department members executing a variety of health-related research studies. The successful applicant will plan and perform statistical analyses for diverse research projects with complex study designs; advise team members regarding optimal statistical approaches for testing specific research questions and hypotheses; and teach and mentor junior data analysts.  MAJOR RESPONSIBILITES WILL INCLUDE: Working as a part of a team to design and conduct research projects related to the health of military service members. Constructing, cleaning, and maintaining research databases. Using SAS, SPSS, and/or other statistical programs to conduct statistical analyses (including multilevel modeling, structural equation analysis, ANOVA and regression analysis, survival analysis, general estimating equations, cluster analysis, etc.) in support of various research projects. Providing statistical guidance, consultation, support, and training to individual researchers and research teams. Writing technical reports and scientific manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals. Preparing and presenting briefings to project sponsors, military leaders, and researchers at professional meetings and conferences. REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: Subject matter expertise and research experience in an area(s) related to behavioral health and/or health promotion. Advanced knowledge of statistics, including: multilevel modeling; structural equation modeling; analysis of variance and regression models; survival analysis, including multiple event modeling and interval censoring; latent growth curve analysis; analyses of longitudinal data; power analysis; evaluating assumptions; and statistical techniques for handling missing data. Advanced experience conducting statistical analyses using SAS, SPSS, and/or other statistical software. Strong written and oral communication skills; ability to prepare presentations and written reports, lead briefings, and teach seminars. Team player who works well with others; ability to lead or support a research team as appropriate. Self-starter who can work independently; ability to plan and prioritize across multiple tasks and projects. Qualifications:REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: (1) Advanced degree (PhD)åÊin Public Health, Psychology, Medicine, or a related field, OR an advanced degree in Statistics or related field, AND (2) demonstrated expertise in designing and conducting behavioral health-related research, AND (3) evidence of strong statistical skills and abilities, including expertise in multilevel modeling and structural equation modeling, AND (4) a high level of proficiency with SAS, SPSS, and/or other widely used statistical software package, AND (5) demonstrated history of presenting and/or publishing empirical research. Two years of related experience is required.DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Experience working with large databases, with archival data, and with medical data. Experience working in a military or veteran setting. Due to contract restrictions, candidate must be a U.S. citizen and will be required to obtain a Secret Clearance.
